She wants her activity to grow but right now she does not have enough money to invest and for this reason Rosa is requesting a loan: she will use it to buy more products such as blouses, skirts, shirts and lingerie, the kind of products her customers ask for. Through the loan her activity will grow, her sales will increase and she will be able to offer her customers a wider selection of clothes of better quality. Rosa dreams of improving her activity and of earning the necessary income to provide for the daily necessities of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Shafqat's Group

texts.en:
Shafqat lives in Gujranwala which is an industrial city of Pakistan. She is a 37-year-old lady who has given birth to three daughters and two sons. All of them are attending school and getting their education except the youngest one who is just 18 months old.

Shafqat’s husband’s name is B. K. and he has a business selling crockery. He sells both plastic and glass crockery sets to his customers and generates an income for the family. He also supplies dinner sets of plastic and glass to different crockery sellers for a good profit.

Shafqat has applied for a loan for her husband from Kiva partner, Asasah. With the loan he will buy more crockery sets to increase his sales. Shafqat is hopeful that this investment will prove beneficial for her husband’s business and that he will make a good income from it and be able to improve the living standard of his family.

Shafqat is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan. In previous years she has proved herself as a very dependable client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy more crockery sets for his business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 46 años, vive con sus 4 hijos y su madre en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a vender cerveza durante los fines de semana, asimismo cuando se presenta alguna actividad como celebraciones o fiestas patronales tiene más salida de venta de este producto. Por otro lado se dedica también a cuidar sus animales, así como cuidar su campos agrícolas, en donde siembra papa, maíz, arveja y habas. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo para vigilar sus animales, mientras Juana vende cervezas. Afirma que este negocio la ayuda a afrontar las carencias económicas, ya que le genera las rentas necesarias mientras espera la temporada de cosecha, por tal motivo desea incrementar su capital  de trabajo. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más cajas de cerveza, asimismo desea comprar sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Juana is 46 years old and she lives with her 4 children and her mother in a house she owns. She has been engaging in selling beer for more than 3 years: she works during the weekend and also during special events such as celebrations or festivals, when she sells a higher quantity of her product. She also engages in agriculture, taking care of her lands where she plants potatoes, maize, peas and broad beans. Sometimes her son helps her taking care of her animals while she sells beer. She says this activity helps her facing her financial problems, as it generates enough income to get by until the harvesting season, and for this reason she wants to increase her working capital. This is her second loan with MFP: she is very happy to know she can count on economic support as she has always been responsible with her repayments. She also likes being part of her communal bank as all its members are very responsible and caring people. She is thankful to those lenders who will manage the loan she is requesting, as it will be very helpful in the development of her activity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more beer cases, as well as some more bags of fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more beer cases.

loans.name: Daysi Elizabeth

texts.es:
Daysi es una señora que se dedica a la venta de pupusas y panes con pollo, está casada y tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 19, 12 y 8 años, ellos residen en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután; el negocio fue iniciativa propia ubicándolo en su propia casa, y lo atiende desde las cuatro de la tarde hasta las diez de la noche.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de Maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, pollo todo para la elaboración de la pupusas y los panes, Deysi desea invertir para aumentar su preparación y así que sus ventas e ingresos sean mejores y poder ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos diarios.
Este préstamo ayudara a fortalecer su negocio a cubrir mayores demandas de los clientes. Doña Daysi aspira tener un negocio grande, con muchos clientes para darle a su familia una mejor vida y que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Daysi engages in selling “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas) and “panes con pollo” (bread stuffed with chicken). She is married and has 3 children aged 19, 12 and 8: they all live in Jucuapa, in the Usulutáan department. She stated this activity of her own volition establishing it in her own house, and working form 4 pm to 10 pm. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy maize, pork cracklings, quesillos (tortillas with cream cheese filling) and chicken to prepare pupusas and chicken stuffed bread. Daysi wants to invest in her activity to increase her production: this will help her improve her sales and increase her income, thus being able to provide for her children and face their daily expenses. Through this loan she will consolidate her activity and satisfy a higher number of requests. Daysi wishes to own a big shop and to have many customers, in order to offer to her family better life conditions; she also wishes that her son get an education and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare pupusas and chicken stuffed bread.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie B. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 6 children, four of whom are in school. Winnie has a business of retail shop. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days a week. Winnie sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Winnie has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

The main business challenge for Winnie is the transportation of her merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala city to her shop. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop. Winnie lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ruharo Twimukye Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
K. Slivia of Ruharo Twimukye group, Bushenyi, a mature happily-married father of 2 children, has been running a salon business for 12 years from Ruharo Trading centre, Bushenyi, alongside other agricultural activities. With all her efforts, she has been able to maintain earning 180,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis. This income has always been significant in contributing towards her family's welfare. Her current set-back is lacking additional capital to purchase salon materials such as hair cutting machines, shampoo, hair oils and a drier (the basics demanded her lady customers) and further investing in her farming projects for better yields

Therefore, this loan will help Slivia in restocking business requirements that will see her get more sales revenue as she looks at opening a bigger salon in a large town and educating her children.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna N. lives in the Kamwokya Kifumbira neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).

Berna has a business of selling children’s clothes. She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 7 days a week. Berna sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail. Berna has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more of children clothes like baby shawls, baby bags and nappy liners. 

The main business challenge(s) for Berna include ever-increasing prices of children clothes and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own house. Berna lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more children's clothes.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is a resident of Gujranwala which is located in Punjab and is famous for its industrial importance. She is a housewife who spends all day at home taking care of her family and doing her household tasks. But, in her spare time, she does embroidery for her neighboring clients. She doesn’t take this work as a profession but she could do so if she started getting a good income from it.

Suraiya is the mother of three daughters and two sons, all of them receiving an education. Suraiya, herself, is illiterate and couldn’t obtain an education due to the poor financial situation of her parents, but she doesn’t want the same fate for her children; she is giving them an education and wants them to complete it.

Suraiya husband has a furniture-selling business. He operates his furniture showroom in the market where he displays ready-made furniture sets. Suraiya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more furniture sets for his furniture showroom. He thinks that by offering more choice to his clients he can make more sales. Suraiya is hopeful that her husband will be able to get the desired results by making this investment in his business.

Suraiya is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan. She has proved herself a responsible client who has never missed a meeting and has paid her installments on time.

In the photo, Suraiya is the lady who holds a book (called her Asasah Passbook) in her hand.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy more furniture sets for his business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 16 y 18 años de edad, residen en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, él es agricultor dedicándose a la siembra de Maíz y Frijol desde que tenía 10 años, pues su padre también se dedico a este oficio y le enseño a don Daniel quien no tiene dificultad para desarrollar hoy día esta actividad.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono, semilla y tratamiento para cuido de plagas, porque quiere cultivar Maíz y frijol pero no cuenta con los materiales necesarios para realizar la siembra.
Este préstamo ayudara a que él pueda sembrar  y llevar la alimentación que su familia necesita.
Él sueño de don Daniel es seguir trabajando la tierra, producir más alimentos para ayudar a su familia y juntos salir adelante, también desea preparar a sus hijos y que estos terminen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Daniel is 52 years old and he lives together with his wife and their two children, 16 and 18 years old. They reside in El Transito, located in San Miguel. he is an agriculturist, dedicating these past 10 years to harvesting corn and beans. His father was also an agriculturist and it was he who showed Daniel. Today Daniel has no problem in managing his business. He requests a loan to purchase fertlizer, seeds, and pesticides to ward off any plaguing insects. He wishes to harvest corn and beans but he doesn't have the materials to start the plantation. This loan will help him sow the fields and in turn, he will be able to feed his family. Daniel's dream is to keep working his fields, to produce more product and to support his family. He also wishes to prepare his children and see them achieve a university level career.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to plant corn and beans

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 55 años, vive al lado de sus 3 hijas en su casa propia. Desde muy joven, aprendió a hacer lindos decorados en material de corrospum (material micro poroso, tipo plástico de diferentes colores) para centros educativos y fiestas infantiles. Siendo profesora de profesión le ha dado la ventaja necesaria para tener lo clientes, ya que sus colegas siempre solicitan estos trabajos, resultándole una buena fuente de ingresos. Le entretiene mucho realizar esta actividad manual, por que le permite diseñar personajes animados, sin embargo le fue difícil mantenerse en este negocio, pero al fin lo logró. Actualmente tiene varios pedidos de diferentes centros educativos, en cada época del año, lo cual esta procurando cumplir con toda la demanda de sus clientes. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar donde pueda ofrecer diferentes productos y también los diseños que realiza en corrospun. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como corrospum, pegamento y también telas ya que realizará más material educativo en base a telas.
texts.en:
Delfina is 55 years old and she lives together with her three daugthers in their own home. From a very young age she learned to make beautiful decorations of foam (a plastic material that is spongy and comes in various colors) for schools and for kids' parties. Having worked as a teacher she has had the advantage of knowing the clients. Her colleagues always make requests for her work, resulting in a good source of income. She takes a great deal of time to make these crafts, designing different animated characters. While it has been very difficult to keep up this business but in the end it all worked out. She has a number of orders that remain unfilled from various school. She is trying to meet her clients' demands. In the future she has a small store from where to display her various products and different designs. This will be her fifth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very ahppy to have the financial support. She has always shown responsibility with her payments. She also enjoys taking part in the community bank with all the other members because they, too, are responsible members. She is grateful to all those individuals that will lend her money because it will be key in the progress of her business. The loan she requests will be invested in the purchase of materials, such as foam, glue, and fabrics to make her educational displays.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials such as glue, foam, and fabrics.

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is 44 years old and lives in an industrial city called Gujranwala, Pakistan. She owns a house with three rooms and has lived in it with her family for the last twenty-six years. Her husband works in a gas station, her elder son runs a grocery shop in the market, and her youngest son does laboring work.

Irshad supports her family by doing sewing work. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and completes them on time to earn an income for her family. She is good at her job and receives regular orders. 

Irshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son’s grocery shop. With the loan, he will buy groceries for his shop to offer more variety to his customers. Irshad hopes that her son will be able to expand his business by making proper use of the loan money.

Irshad is a regular loan user and this is her 4th loan. She has maintained a good credit behavior in previous years and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To enable her son to buy more groceries for his shop

loans.name: Erlinda Edubina

texts.es:
Erlinda de 32 años, tiene una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales. Su esposo es vendedor ellos tienen tres hijos. 

Ella empezó vendiendo cuadernos a sus vecinos y amigos, con algunos ahorros que tenia comenzó a comprar papelería para tener mas ingresos, poco a poco pudo comprar una vitrina y readecuar su casa para ubicar el negocio en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Para poder surtirlo con mas mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos, papelería, bebidas. En el futuro quiere agrandar su papelería y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Erlinda is 32 years old and she has an office supply store in the front section of her house. She lives in Fortin de Guayaquil, a region known for its unpaved roads and for its vendors. Her husband is a vendor and they have three children together. She started out selling notebooks to her neighbours and her friends. With her modest earnings she was able to purchase other office supplies and increase her income. Eventually she managed to purchase a display case and she was able to remodel a section of her house from where to run her business. In order to restock her business with more merchandise she would requests a loan. With it she will purchase notebooks, office supplies, and soft drinks. In the future she hopes to expand her office supply store and she wishes to see her children successfully complete their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase notebooks and office supplies.

loans.name: Saul Ernesto

texts.es:
Saúl posee un taller de bicicletas donde repara y vende repuestos, tiene 36 años, está casado y vive junto a su esposa y su hija de 6 años de edad quienes dependen económicamente de él. El negocio lo comenzó hace 6 años con un horario de siete de la mañana a seis de la tarde, el coloco su taller de bicicletas en un lugar donde actualmente no existe otro taller, lo que le permite atender a los clientes de la zona.
Saúl solicita un préstamo para comprar repuestos de bicicletas y así poder aumentar su inventario,  para atender a sus clientes mejor ya que les ofrecerá mayor diversidad de artículos satisfaciendo las necesidades de ellos, su único riesgo es que las ventas bajen ya que esto afectara sus ingresos familiares.
Las aspiraciones de él es crecer como microempresario, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Saul has a bicycle repair shop from where he services bicycles and sells spare parts. He is 36 years old, he is married and he lives together with his wife and their 6-year old daughter. They are both financially dependent on him. He started his business 6 years ago, working from 6am to 6pm. He set up his shop in a region where there are no other repair shops around, allowing him to meet the client need in the entire region. Saul requests a loan to purchase bicycle spare parts, to increase his inventory, and to be better equipped to attend his clients. He will be able to offer them a greater variety of products to meet their needs. His only risk is to have a decline in his sales because it will translate into a reduced income for his family. His aspiration is to advance as a small business owner and to improve the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bicycle parts for repair.

loans.name: Wilfrido Alejandro

texts.es:
Wilfrido de 56 años, tiene una tienda de víveres, vive en una casa de caña y cemento ubicada en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales.

Cuando la esposa falleció el comenzó a comprar mercadería para tener una pequeña tienda de víveres ya que se sentía solo en su casa. Poco a poco surtió su pequeña tienda y la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

El quiere surtir mas su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, bebidas, azúcar etc. En el futuro quiere tener mas arreglado su negocio para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Wilfrido is 56 years old and he has a grocery store. He lives in a house made of cane sticks and cement and it is located in Fortin de Guyaquil, a region known for its unpaved roads and its vendors. When his wife passed away, he decided to purchase merchandise to set up a small grocery store to keep himself from feeling so alone. He gradually increased the variety in his store, located in the front section of his house. He works from 6am to 9pm every day. He would like to stock his store, for which reason he requests a loan. He will purchase rice, soft drinks, sugar etc. In the future he hopes to have a better equipped business, to secure his old age.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, sugar, rice.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 40 años, vive al lado de su esposa y su hijo en una casa arrendada. Desde hace varios meses se dedica a la venta de  animales menores como pollos y patos, que previos son comprados al por mayor en granjas de prestigio, por lo que luego son vendidos en restaurantes y en ferias ganaderas. Asimismo trabaja como chofer de taxi, actividad que lo realiza durante la semana, mientras que la venta de animales, lo realiza los fines de semana. En ocasiones su esposa la apoya en este negocio, ya que le es muy rentable pero requiere de mucha dedicación y esfuerzo. Procura siempre que los animales que adquiere estén bien alimentados para así venderlos a un buen precio, es por esta razón que desea en el futuro tener su propia granja de aves donde pueda tener gran cantidad de animales. 

Es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de calaminas ya que empezará con la construcción de su granja.
texts.en:
Javier is 40 years old and lives with his wife and son in a rented house. For several months he has sold small animals like chickens and ducks, which he purchases wholesale from large farms to resell to restaurants and at livestock shows. He also works as a taxi driver during the week and sells the animals on the weekends. His wife occasionally helps him with this business since it is very profitable, but it requires great dedication and effort. He always tries to acquire well-fed animals so he can sell them for a good price; it is for this reason that he wants in the future to have his own poultry farm where he can have a large number of animals. This is Javier's sixth loan with MFP. He is very happy to know that he has financial support since they know he is responsible with his payments. He is also grateful to be part of his communal bank because all its members are people he knows, and they are responsible and very close-knit. He thanks all the people who have made this loan possible, and it will be very useful to him in his business' growth. With the loan he is requesting, he will invest in the purchase of corrugated metal sheets since he will begin construction on his farm.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for construction on his poultry farm

loans.name: Ana Cecinia

texts.es:
Ana Cecinia tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el caserío Cerro de Falla, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito de Olmos, un distrito agrícola que produce principalmente frutas como el limón y el mango, la zona se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros. Ella adquiere su mercadería en las ciudades de Chiclayo y Lambayeque y las ofrece en venta a los vecinos de su caserío y de zonas aledañas. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a que es difícil para sus vecinos adquirir estos productos ya que residen en una zona alejada del pueblo central y la movilidad es dificil.

Ella suele ofrecer sus productos por pedidos y también recorre la zona ofreciéndolos tanto al crédito como al contado. Actualmente desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas prendas para ofrecerlas en venta, para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ana es una joven que trabaja mucho para apoyar a sus padres, su mas grande anhelo es seguir haciéndose conocida en el rubro y captar mas clientes para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres. Anteriormente ha tenido un crédito con Edpyme Alternativa y lo ha cancelado de manera responsable.
texts.en:
Ana Cecinia is 24 years old, single and lives with her family in the village of Cerro de Falla, a rural area in the Olmos District. It is a mainly agricultural district which produces fruits like lemon and mango, and is located in the Lambayeque Province, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked for over two years selling apparel for both women and men. She acquires her merchandise in the cities of Chiclayo and Lambayeque and offers it for sale to residents of her village and in surrounding areas. The business is very well received because it is difficult for neighbors to buy these products; they reside in a remote area far from the town's center and mobility is difficult. She usually accepts orders for her products throughout the area, selling on credit as much as by cash. She would like to expand her business by purchasing more clothing for sale. To achieve her goal, she has decided to request a loan of $375 through Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. Ana is a young woman who works hard to support her parents. Her greatest wish is to continue becoming known in the business to attract more customers so that she can improve the her parents' quality of life. Previously she had a loan with Alternative Edpyme which was repaid in a responsible manner.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sales business expansion.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
la sra. Teofila C. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en el Barrio el Puente Trojes El Paraiso, Teofila se dedica a la venta de granos de maiz, este tipo de negocio es muy bueno ya que muchas personas compran maiz para hacer tortillas, tamalitos y tambien lo compran para comida para animales.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de sacos de maiz ya que las exigencias de sus clientes han incrementado y a veces se queda sin maiz para la venta.
esta es la unica actividad que Teofila realiza para generar dinero para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Teofila C. is 59 and lives in the el Puente Trojes El Paraiso neighbourhood. Teofila sells corn. This type of business is very good since many people buy corn to make tortillas and tamalitos, and they also buy it for animal food. She will use this loan for the purchase of bags of corn since demand has increased and at times she runs out of corn to sell. This is Teofila's only job to generate income to cover her household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of corn

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Desde hace un año posee una tienda de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa. Atendiendo durante las tardes, puesto que es profesora y durante las mañanas trabaja en un centro educativo, por ello se vio en la necesidad de contratar a una persona para que le ayude en la atención durante las horas que esta ausente. Le agrada su negocio porque le permite tener las entradas económicas que necesita para complementar con el sueldo que recibe cada mes, y con ello poder asumir los gastos que tiene dentro de su familia. En el futuro desea tener una tienda más grande y más repleta de mercadería. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en abarrotes y menestras.
texts.en:
Mery is 47 and lives with her husband and son in their own house. For a year she has had a grocery store, which is located in the house. She tends it during the afternoons, since she is a teacher and works at an educational center in the mornings. That is why she found it necessary to hire someone to help her watch the store in the times she is not there. She is grateful for her business because it permits her to have the income she needs to complement the salary she receives every month, and with it she can cover her family's expenses. In the future she would like to have a larger store with more merchandise. This is Mery's first loan with MFP. She is very happy to know she has financial support. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all its members are responsible people and are a very close-knit group. She would like to thank all the people who have made this loan possible, as it will be very useful to her in her business' growth. With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple items to stock her store

loans.name: Alfonso Vicente

texts.es:
Alfonso de 30 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales. Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Escogió tener una tienda hace dos años para poder mantener a sus cuatro hijos, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. No ha tendido muchos problemas por el volumen de clientes que tiene diario porque su esposa le ayuda con la tienda. 

En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y tener otra tienda para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos pero para llegar a eso el quiere comprar con el préstamo azúcar, arroz, lácteos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Alfonso lives in the Fortín de Guayaquil, an area characterized by its unpaved roads and informal storekeepers and vendors. He has a small general store in the front of his house. He chose to open his store two years ago to support his four children. Since the opening, he has worked from 5 a.m. to 11 p.m. every day. He has not had many problems with the number of customers that he has every day because his wife helps him in the store. Looking ahead, he would like to make some improvements to his house and have another store to assure that his children have a bright future. As a first step toward achieving these goals, he will use this loan to buy sugar, rice, and dairy products for his store.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, and dairy products

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesus

texts.es:
Narcisa de 50 años,  tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales.

Por la falta de oportunidades ella invirtió sus ahorros en víveres para vender ya que tenia que mantener a sus hijos porque es madre soltera, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días, vende arroz por libra, azúcar, aceites, verduras etc.  

Para seguir con su negocio y poderlo surtirlo mas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites, azúcar. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Narcisa, 50, has a small grocery store in the front part of her house. She lives in El Fortín, Guayaquil, an area noted for its unpaved streets and informal merchants. Due to the lack of employment opportunities she used her savings to buy foodstuffs to sell because she had to support her children since she’s a single mother. Since then and to this date she works every day from 8am until 9pm. She sells rice by the pound, sugar, cooking oils, vegetables, etc. To continue with her business and stock it better she needs to use the loan to buy rice, cooking oils and sugar. In the future she’d like to finish building her house and stock her store better.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, cooking oils and sugar.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 54 años, vive en casa de su hija mayor, en compañía de su esposo y sus nietos. Hace más de 5 años trabaja junto a su hija, en el restaurante en el que ambas son socias, y aunque no tiene responsabilidad alguna, lo hace por sus nietos, que a diario se esfuerza por levantarse muy temprano para realizar las compras y preparar los diversos platillos, que son del gusto de sus clientes. Su buena sazón le ha proporcionado las ganancias que necesita para mantener a su familia. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora tiene planeado para el futuro seguir en el negocio de la cocina, por lo que desea mejorar cada vez más su sazón, por ello se capacitará constantemente. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de tazas, platos y todos los cubiertos para su restaurante.
texts.en:
Gloria is 54 years old and lives in her elder daughter's house with her husband and their grandchildren. For more than five years she has worked with her daughter in a restaurant in which they are both partners, and although she has no responsibility, she does it for her grandchildren. Every day she makes the effort to get up very early to do the shopping and prepare the various dishes that their customers like. Her good cooking has provided the income she needs to support her family. As she is a very enterprising woman, she has plans to continue the cooking business in the future. For this reason she wants to improve her cooking, so she will train constantly. This is Gloria's fifth loan from MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has always been responsible with her payments. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible people and are a very close-knit group. She would like to thank all the people who have made this loan possible, as it will be very useful to her in her business' growth. She will use the loan to purchase cups, plates and all the silverware for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase utensils and kitchen materials

loans.name: Nery Maria

texts.es:
la sra. Nery N. tiene 43 años de edad vive en la colonia Monte Cristo de la ciudad de Danli, Nery se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion la cual opera bajo el nombre de pulperia NERY.
actualmente tiene a sus hijos estudiando y estan cursando la educacion secundaria y primaria.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio, las ganancias las necesita para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
dice sentirse muy feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo cada dia mas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nery N., 43, lives in Danli’s Monte Cristo neighborhood. She sells basic needs items in her grocery store, called NERY, located in her home. Her children are currently in primary and secondary school. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store. She uses the profits to help her husband meet household expenses. She says he’s very happy because her business is growing more each day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages, bags, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, lard, oil, salt, matches, soups, pasta, spaghetti, toilet paper, sweets, juices, dairy products, milk, corn flour, wheat flour, tortillas, sanitary napkins.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jessica Guadalupe

texts.es:
Jessica de 33 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales. Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la casa de sus padres.  

Tenia 18 años cuando comenzó con su pequeña tienda con el fin de darles a sus pares un pequeño negocio ya que ellos no tenían mucha estabilidad económica, fue así que comenzó a trabajar y a invertir sus ahorros en víveres y venderlos. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas víveres como arroz, azúcar, bebidas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere ampliar el negocio y poder ubicar otra tienda en otro lugar para tener mas ingresos y poder ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Jessica, 33, lives in El Fortín, Guayaquil, an area noted for its unpaved streets and informal merchants. She has a small grocery store in her parents’ house. She was 18 years old when she opened the store with the goal in mind to provide her parents with a small business since they didn’t have much economic stability. She started working when she used her savings to buy foodstuffs to sell. Since then and to this day she works from 6am until 10pm daily. She will use the loan to buy more stock items like rice, sugar and beverages for the store. In the future she’d like to expand it and be able to open a second store somewhere else to earn more income and be able to help her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, sugar and beverages.

loans.name: Damaris De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. Damaris de Jesus G. M. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en Las Delicias Trojes El Paraiso.
Damaris se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor y asi surtir mas su negocio ya que los carros que reparten los productos solo pasan una vez por semana y a veces se queda sin producto y tiene que esperar varios dias para poder abastecerse de nuevo, esto le ocaciona perdidas en su negocio.
Damaris nos comento que se siente feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien y que las ganancias las necesita para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Damaris de Jesús Gonzáles M., 40, lives in Las Delicias Trojes, El Paraíso. She has a small grocery store in her home where she sells basic needs items. The loan will be used to buy merchandise at wholesale to better stock her store because the delivery trucks that deliver products only come through her neighborhood once a week and sometimes she runs out of product and has to wait several days to restock. This leads to lost sales. Damaris told us that she is very happy because everything is turning out well and that she needs the profits to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs, lard, rice, beans, oil, margarine, milk, beverages, bread, coffee, matches, candles, soups, pasta, soap, chilies, spices, salt, corn and wheat flour, tortillas and toilet paper.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: Jovita, de 25 años, es una joven madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Félix de 26 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Nicole de 7 y Puyol de 4 años, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Los días de Jovita comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su esposo recorren los verdes cerros de su poblado, hasta llegar a sus cultivos y comienzan su labor diaria de trabajar la tierra, cultivando arveja y papa que son de muy buena calidad, motivo por el cual son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Jovita, 25, is a young, very unassuming, hard working mother. She lives in her own house with her husband, Félix, 26, and their two beloved children, Nicole, 7, and Puyol, 4, for whom she wants to provide a better future. Jovita starts her day very early in the morning when she and her husband wander over the green hills in their township until they reach their farmlands and then start their daily work of tilling the soil, cultivating peas and potatoes which are of very good quality and therefore highly sought after in Tarma’s wholesale market. What she enjoys the most about her work is caring for the crops. She has been in this line of work for 8 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to transport her product to Tarma because the sacks are very heavy and they tire her out a lot. In the future she’d like to buy new fields to increase production. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she expects to be very punctual with her repayments because she doesn’t want to cause her communal bank, in which she is very happy, any problems. She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy more manure to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Luis Albeto

texts.es:
Luis de 28 años, vende verduras y frutas en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales. 

El antes trabajaba vendiendo cofres mortuorios para poder mantener a su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 6 años. Pero como quería pasar mas tiempo con su familia invirtió sus ahorros en víveres y puso una pequeña tienda en la ventana de su casa. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ha vendido verduras, frutas y  víveres.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceites y bebidas para diferenciar su negocio no solo con verduras sino con mas víveres, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is 28 years old and sells fruits and vegetables from the front of his house. He lives in Fortín de Guayaquil, an area characterized by unpaved roads and many informal businesses. Earlier, he worked selling burial caskets to support his wife and his two children, aged 10 and 6. However, since he wanted to spend more time with his family, he invested his savings in groceries and set up a small store in the front window of his house. Since that time, he has been selling vegetables, fruits and groceries. With the loan, he would like to buy rice, cooking oil and soft drinks, so he can expand his store, offering a wider range of grocery items as well as produce. In the future, he would like to finish constructing his house and expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, cooking oil and soft drinks

loans.name: Santos Ancelma

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Ancelma C. M. tiene 58 años de edad, vive en las Delicias Trojes El Paraiso.
Santos tiene una pequeña pulperia ubbicada en su casa de habitacion, tiene poco tiempo de tener su negocio.
nos comento que en estos momentos desea comprar mas productos para poder surtirla y tener mas inventario ya que tiene el problema de que los carros repartidores pasan solo una vez por semana y esto le ocaciona perdidas en sus ventas.
el credito lo va a utilizar para comprar mercaderia.
las ganancias las necesita para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos Ancelma C. Martínez, 58, lives in Las Delicias Trojes, El Paraíso. She has a small grocery store in her home. She has had it for a short time. She told us that she wants to buy more items to stock the store and have more inventory available because she has the problem that delivery trucks only come by once a week and this leads to lost sales. She will use the loan to buy merchandise. She needs profits to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, cookies, lard, rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, margarine, toilet paper, salt, corn and wheat flour, bags, beverages, milk, cheese, butter, soap, sardines, juices, matches, candles, batteries.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio, de 40 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Cristina de 37 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Con el apoyo de su esposa, Julio decidió comprar hace unos años, unos terrenos en los cuales pudiera trabajar y así mejorar la economía de su familia. Actualmente esos terrenos los sigue trabajando, pero ahora son mucho más productivos, ya que sus cultivos de papa, arveja, gladiolo y olluco son de muy buena calidad y con el paso del tiempo ha aprendido a obtener la mayor producción de sus chacras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la relación tan cercana que tiene con la tierra, además disfruta mucho viendo sus sembríos crecer, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus campos de las inclemencias del clima, ya que cualquier descuido puede afectar la cosecha. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP; esta muy contento por obtenerlo, ya que lo necesita urgentemente para mejorar su negocio. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que siempre pone mucho orden en las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Julio, 40, is an unassuming, hard working man. He lives in his own house with his wife, Cristina, 37, and their five beloved children for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. With his wife’s support he decided a few years ago to buy some fields to till to improve his family’s economy. Currently, he is working those fields and they are now much more productive in that his potato, pea, gladiolas and olluco (an Andean tuber) crops are of very good quality. He has learned over time how to obtain the best yields from his farmland. What he likes best about his work is the close relationship he has with the soil; he also enjoys watching his plants grow. He has been in this line of work for 15 years and considers the most difficult part of it protecting his crops from the inclement weather because the slightest distraction can affect the crops. In the future he’d like to buy new fields to increase production. This is his 4th loan with MFP. He is very happy to get it because he urgently needs it to improve his business. He is very well liked in his communal bank because he always imposes much order during the meetings. He will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more manure to improve crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Rosa Lastenia

texts.es:
la sra. Rosa Lastenia C. M. tiene 53 años de edad, vive en el Barrio el Puente Trojes El Paraiso, Rosa se dedica a la venta de carne de res y cerdo, tiene mucha experiencia en la venta de carnes.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar carne a precio de mayorista, ya que asi logra tener mas ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y para mantener a su familia.
las ventas buenas son los fines de semana cuando las personas compran la carne para toda la semana.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Lastenia C. Martínez, 53, lives in the El Puente neighborhood, Trojes, El Paraíso. She sells beef and pork. She has a lot of experience selling meats. She will use the loan to buy meat at wholesale prices so that her profits will be better. She needs the profits to meet household expenses and to support her family. Sales are best on weekends when customers buy meat for the entire week.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Estanislaa

texts.es:
La Sra. Celia  D. 68 años D. edad , casada tiene 3 hijos , todos ya  formaron sus propias  familias,  sólo uno D. ellos vive con ella .
Es oriunda luego D. la ciudad D. San Antonio, siempre se dedicó al comercio, pues se dedicaba a comprar y vender mercerías y bazar en forma ambulante, pero luego D. a poco fue ahorrando y decidió habilitar una despensa bien surtida en su domicilio, y así D. esa manera ya no salir fuera D. su casa, y compartir un poco más D. su familia, su esposo actualmente ya no trabaja, por la edad pero le ayuda atendiendo el negocio, que ya tiene 25 años.
La misma ha recurrido al crédito pues le permite abaratar los costos D. las mercaderías comprándolo al contado, ya que como tiene  proveedores que le hacen llegar los productos y a veces no cuenta con suficiente capital entonces los deja a créditos, es por eso que ella cuida mucho en devolver en forma puntual cuando acceD. a un préstamo porque eso le permite renovar en forma más ágil el siguiente.
texts.en:
Celia is 68 years old. She is married and has 3 children, all of who have their own familes. Only one of them lives with her. She is from the city of San Antonio. She has always been a merchant; she would buy and sell merchandise in a variety store and as a street vendor. Later, little by little she saved up and decided to outfit a well supplied convenience store in her home. That way, she wouldn't have to leave her house and she could spend more time with her family. Her husband is not working at this time due to his age, but he helps her attend to the business, which they have had now for 25 years. She has turned to loans because it allows her to keep costs down by buying merchandise up front. She has suppliers that bring her products and at times she doesn't have enough capital so she buys on credit. That is why she is very careful to make her payments on time when she has a loan because this allows her to renew easily the next time.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her kiosk such as herbs, snacks, baked goods and beverages.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Federico de 40 años y sus dos menores hijos Geral de 14 y Wilbert de 7 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Las fértiles tierras del poblado de Huaripampa, le han brindado a Merced un lugar ideal para cultivar arvejas y papa, productos con los que alimenta a su familia y a la vez gana el dinero necesario para el sustento de su hogar, ya que debido a la buena calidad de su cosecha siempre obtiene muy buenos precios en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, que es el lugar donde vende sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende el progreso de su negocio, lleva 22 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es  fumigar sus cultivos, ya que los químicos que utiliza son muy peligrosos para su salud. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras a sus vecinos, ya que siente que es hora de incrementar la cantidad de su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida, por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus chacras e invertirá también en la compra de insumos para evitar que la plaga de insectos dañe sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 40 years old and is a very happy and hardworking mother. She lives in her own house with her 40-year-old husband Federico and their two young boys Geral (14) and Wilbert (7), who are the main motivation for all of her efforts.

The fertile lands of Huaripampa have provided Mercedes with an ideal place to grow peas and potatoes, products that she uses to feed her family. At the same time, they also provide the money necessary to support the household. Her crops are of good quality so they always have good prices at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where she sells them. What she likes most about her work is planting since she knows that this determines her business’ progress. She has been in this business for 22 years and considers the most difficult part to be spraying her crops because the chemicals used are dangerous for her health. In time, she wants to buy new lands from her neighbors because she feels as though now is the time to increase her amount of production.

This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she needs to make her payments on time and she is prepared to do so because she does not want to cause any problems for the members of her communal bank, where she is very well-liked for the order that brings to the meetings. With the 800 PEN she is requesting, she will purchase more fertilizer for her lands and also invest in the purchase of products to prevent pests from damaging her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer, as well as products to prevent pests from damaging her crops.

loans.name: Flores Magon Group

texts.es:
Esta unidad de desarrollo se llama “FLORES MAGON” comentan que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que la mayoría de las integrantes viven en ese andador llamado Flores Magon. Este grupo está ubicado en el municipio de Zitacuaro en el estado de Michoacán. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes. 
La representante del grupo se llama María Socorro S. Díaz. Doña Soco como le dice su familia y conocidos tiene 43 años de edad, estudio la carrera técnica de secretaria ejecutiva, dice que no ejerció su carrera por que se caso muy joven y su esposo ya no la dejo trabajar para que se dedicara por completo a su casa e hijos. Doña Soco, es una mujer muy trabajadora, su esposo con el tiempo se dio cuenta que no era suficiente lo que el ganaba para mantener a su familia por eso ella decidió ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar, y entonces emprendió un negocio de plásticos. Ahora ellos dos se dedican a la venta de bolsa de plástico, vasos, platos de unicel, cucharas, tenedores, etc. Comenta que sus clientes son gente que tiene puestos en el mercado, tortilleros y panaderos, tiene trabajando en este hace 7 años, tiene su puesto de plásticos fuera del mercado de Zitacuaro Michoacán donde también vende ropa interior para dama y manualidades como juegos de baño, servilletas, bolsas decoradas etc. La señora Socorro está casada con el señor Mario desde hace 22 años ellos tienen 3 hijas de nombres Marisol de 22 años, Stephanie de 19 años de edad, ellas dos casadas, y Carol de 17 años quien estudia la licenciatura en pedagogía en la escuela normal de Zitacuaro, doña Socorro tiene la esperanza que su hija la menor termine la carrera porque dice que es la mejor herencia que un padre le puede dejar a sus hijos.
  
Roció Sanromán M., ella es parte del grupo “Flores Magon”, tiene 29 años, está estudiando la preparatoria abierta en este momento porque sus papas no tenían dinero para comprarle el uniforme y los utiles escolares, dice que su esposo es una gran ayuda para ella porque él la motiva a salir adelante para que estudie una carrera. Doña Rosi como le dicen sus amigos y familiares se dedica a vender dulces, jugos, chicharrones preparados con soya, refrescos, frituras, paletas de hielo etc., frente al hospital regional de Zitacuaro, tiene con su negocio 2 años, comenta que empezó a vender sus jugos y demás cosas porque ella veía que las personas que tenían enfermos en el hospital no tenían que almorzar y por eso ella decidió poner su puesto, otro de los motivos por el cual puso su puesto fue que le quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. La señora Rosi, está casada con el señor Salvador, el es abogado y tienen una niña de seis años llamada Leylan que estudia el primer año de primaria. Dice la señora Rosi que su meta en la vida es poder hacer un local estable donde pueda vender sus dulces y vender bisutería ya que le gusta diseñar collares y pulseras de pedrería, otra de sus metas es terminar la preparatoria y terminar la carrera de Licenciado en Derecho. Comenta que con las ganancias que saque de vender sus dulces y jugos ahorrara para comprar un terreno para hacer el local que tanto sueña.

Los otros 9 integrantes se llaman María Guadalupe Julián C., Reyna P. E., Isabel M. García, Clementina Solís S., Stephanie Sanromán S., Teresa López P., Perla Janeth M. López Azucena Julián C., María Amparo S. N., ellas quieren los préstamos para invertir en venta de colchas por catalogo, venta de dulces, zapatos por catalogo, manualidades, panadería, cosméticos por catalogo etc.
texts.en:
This development unit is called “FLORES MAGON” [Cipriano Ricardo Flores Magón (September 16, 1874 — November 21, 1922) was a noted Mexican anarchist and social reform activist]. They tell us that they named it thus because most of the members live in a place called Flores Magón. The group is located in the town of Zitácuaro in the state of Michoacán. It has 11 members. The group representative is María Socorro S. Díaz. Doña Soco, as her family and acquaintances call her, is 43 years old. She studied to be an Executive Secretary but says that she never practiced her profession because she married very young and her husband didn’t let her work so that she could dedicate herself totally to home and children. Doña Soco is a very hard working woman. Her husband realized in time that what he earned wasn’t sufficient to support the family so she decided to help him with household expenses and started her plastics business. Now, both of them sell plastic bags, drinking glasses, Styrofoam dishes, spoons, forks, etc. She tells us that her customers are people who have stands in the market, tortilla makers and bakers. She has been in this business for 7 years and has her plastics stand outside the Zitácuaro, Michoacán market where she also sells women’s underwear and crafts like bathroom sets, napkins, decorated purses, etc. Socorro has been married to Mario for 22 years and they have three daughters: Marisol, 22, Stephanie, 19, both married, and Carol, 17 who is studying to be a teacher at the Zitácuaro Normal School. Socorro hopes that her youngest daughter finishes her career because she says that’s the best inheritance a parent can leave her children. Roció Sanromán M., 29, is also part of the “Flores Magón” group. She is currently finishing high school in the Open High School program because her parents couldn’t afford to buy her uniforms and school supplies back when she was in regular school. She says her husband is a great help to her because he encourages her to continue forward and study a career. Doña Rosi, as her friends and family refer to her, sells candies, juices, chicharrones (made from soy), soft-drinks, snacks, popsicles, etc. in front of the Zitácuaro Regional Hospital. She has had the business for two years. She comments that she started selling juices and other items because she noticed that family members of patients in the hospital didn’t have anything to eat at lunch so she decided to set up her stand. Another motive behind her doing this is that she wanted to help her husband meet household expenses. Rosi is married to Salvador, who is an attorney, and they have a six year old daughter named Leylan who is in first grade. Rosi says that her life goal is to have a stable location where she can sell her candy and also sell costume jewelry because she likes to design jeweled necklaces and bracelets. Another one of her goals is to finish high school and then complete a career in Law. She says that profits from the candy and juice sales will be to buy the lot to build the locale she so dreams of. The other nine group members are: María Guadalupe Julián C., Reyna P. E., Isabel M. García, Clementina Solís S., Stephanie Sanromán S., Teresa López P., Perla Janeth M. López Azucena Julián C. and María Amparo S. N.. They want the loans to invest in several lines of work: catalogue bedspread sales, candy sales, catalogue shoe sales, arts and crafts, bakery, catalogue cosmetics sales, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic items: bags, dishes, spoons, etc.

loans.name: El Lirio Group

texts.es:
La señora Miriam Gutiérrez P. tiene cincuenta años de edad, es casada con el señor Rosario G. Gutiérrez, en el cual tienen en su poder a un hijo Rafael de diecisiete años de edad que estudia la preparatoria por que quiere ser ingeniero agrónomo.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar ingredientes, como son: harina, aceite, huevo, royal, canela, para la elaboración de panes, así también comparar pollos para venderlo aliñados (destazados) en la misma comunidad. Para que con ello logre obtener ingresos en su hogar y salga adelante con su familia.

   Lo que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad fue para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y juntos mantenga una aportación para salir adelante dándose el mejor apoyo de trabajar cada uno con su actividad.
Con las ganancias que obtiene de sus dos negocios, compra  todo lo necesario y no verse limitada de ninguna de sus a dos actividades, y pueda tener  mejores ingresos cada día.

   Su sueño es que con sus ahorros logre construir una casita más amplia donde vivir cómodamente, también quiere apoyar a su hijo a que termine una carrera para que tenga mejores logros en la vida.

    Miriam se integro al grupo por una invitación que le izo su hija doña María Irene quien es la representante del grupo a solicitar un préstamo para trabajarlo en sus actividades, el grupo se llama el lirio la razón del grupo es porque en casa de una de ellas tiene une flores de lirio.

   Los integrantes del grupo lirio son tres y cada una con diferente actividad:

  María Irene G. Gutiérrez: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de ropas para venderlo en la región.
  Miriam Gutiérrez P.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes en la elaboración de panes, como son: harina, leche, huevo, aceite, entre otros.
  María de Jesús Ramírez R.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de cortes para su sastrería y elaborar ropas.
texts.en:
Miriam is 50 years old, married to Rosario, and they have a son, Rafael, 17, who is in preparatory school, because he wants to be an agronomic engineer. Miriam is requesting a loan to buy ingredients like wheat, oil, eggs, yeast, and cinnamon, to bake bread. She also wishes to buy chickens to dress and sell in her community. This so she can obtain income and advance her family. She was motivated to carry out this activity to help her husband earning household income and, together, to make a contribution to their advancement, each one giving the best they could with their own activity. With the earnings obtained from her two businesses, she can buy all the necessities and not see herself limited in either of her activities, and she can have better income each day. Miriam's dream is, with her savings, to be able to build a roomier house where they can live comfortably. Also, she wants to help her son finish his education so that he can achieve more in life. Miriam joined the group by invitation of her daughter, Maria Irene, who is the group's representative in soliciting a loan for the group's activities. The group has 3 members, each with a different activity: Maria Irene: borrowing for her business, buying and selling clothes in the region Miriam: to buy ingredientes for baking bread (like flour, milk, eggs, oil, among others) Maria de Jesus: to buy cloth for her sewing shop to make clothes. The group is named “El Lirio” because in one member's house there are irises.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING INGREDIENTS SUCH AS FLOUR, OIL, EGGS, AMONG OTHERS, TO BAKE BREAD TO SELL

loans.name: Magna

texts.es:
Magna B. es una señora D. 37 años  y  tiene 2 hijos, ambos en edad escolar. Magna esta casada y su marido se dedica a trabajar en un camión D. su propiedad, con lo que se complementa la economía D. la familia.
La Sra. posee una despensa desD. hace unos cinco años. Asi también, paralelamente a las ventas realizadas en la despensa pone a disposición D. sus clientes comidas rápidas, ensaladas D. fruta, actividades con las que complementa su despensa. 
El crédito obtenido D. la Fundación Paraguaya lo ha invertido en compra D. mercaderías, D. manera a tener un stock D. productos mas variados como carne, verduras, bebidas, etc. El futuro proyecto D. Magna es incluir venta D. helados a su despensa. 
Magna Agradece el crédito obtenido, pues le permite crecer en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Magna B. is a 37 year old woman who has 2 children, both of them schoolaged. Magna is married and her husband works driving a truck that he owns and uses to support the family. She has had a store for about five years. Along with the store sales, she also offers her customers fast food and fruit salads, activities that complement the store. The loan obtained from Fundación Paraguaya has been invested in purchasing merchandise in order to have stocks of various products such as meat, vegetables, beverages,etc. Magna's future project is to incluD. the sale of ice cream in her store. Magna is grateful for the loan she has obtained as it allows her to grow her enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as: meat, vegetables, beverages and more.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana A. García tiene sesenta y cinco años, vive en Santa Catarina Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Esteban Reyes López, en total tuvo diez hijos quienes todos ya están casados, en su poder tiene a una nieta de nueve años Lithiel Reyes Hernández que cursa  el cuarto grado en la primaria.

    Ella  se dedica a la venta de quesos desde hace diesi ocho años  y  otros productos como son: pinol blanco elaborado de maíz, plátano, hoja de plátano para tamales entre otros, lo cual comenta que la va muy bien con esta actividad y que la asacado de apuros con los gastos de su hogar.

    Su inspiración por este tipo de trabajo, comenzó cuando Hera muy joven ya que ayudaba a su mama a vender en el mercado y cuando se cado dejo de practicarlo, pero cuando se vio en la necesidad comenzó de nuevo y gracias a dios le ha dado buen resultado.

    Con las ganancias que obtiene de su venta, se surte de nuevo para obtener mejores ingresos cada día y para que su clientela adquiera lo que busca para su hogar.

   Su seño es tener trabajo mientras dios le preste  vida  y a horrar para apoyar a su nieta a que termine una carrera y tenga buenos inicios en  la vida, teniendo un buen trabajo para que pueda Salir adelante siendo independiente.

  Juana formo el grupo con sus con pañera ya que le intereso mucho como se trabaja en el programa y se animaron a pertenecer a dicho grupo llamado santa María la razón del nombres por que donde se ubica el grupo se llama santa María.

   Las personas que integran en el grupo son la siguiente:
Juana A. García: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de quesos, como también frutas para venderlo en el mercado.

   Amparo Villarreal M.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de quesos, como  también compra frutas para venderlo en la misma región.

   Aurora Sánchez C.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de carnes variadas, viceras para venderlo en l misma región.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana A. García is 65 years old. She lives in Santa Catarina, Copainala municipality, Chiapas state, México. She is married to Mr. Esteban Reyes López. She had a total of 10 children who are all married now. She has a nine year old granddaughter, Lithiel Reyes Hernández, in her care who is in fourth grade. She has sold cheese for the last 18 years. She also sells other products like: white pinol (a drink made from corn), bananas, banana leaves for tamales, among others. She tells us that she does quite well in this work since it has solved many difficulties regarding household expenses. Her inspiration for this kind of work started when she was quite young for she helped her mother sell in the market. When she married she stopped doing but when she found herself in need she started up again and thanks to God it has had good results. With profits from her sales she stocks up again to earn daily income and so that her customers can find what they are seeking for their homes. Her dream is to have work while God gives her life and to save to support her granddaughter until she finishes a career and has a good start in life, having a good job that she can go forward with and be independent. Juana formed the group with her fellow members because she was very interested in the way the program works and they were encouraged to belong to the group called Santa María, so called because that’s the name of the place it’s located in. The group members are: Juana A. García who will use the loan to buy and sell cheeses as well as fruits in the market; Amparo Villarreal M. who will use the loan to buy and sell cheeses as well as fruits to sell in the same region and Aurora Sánchez C. who will use the loan to buy assorted meats and offal to sell in the same region.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk for cheese making as well as to buy regional products like: banana leaves and chayote, among others.

loans.name: La Parota Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama "La Parota" esta ubicado en Jantetelco, en el estado de Morelos, México y esta conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen y son vecinas. La Señora Tita Gloria A. M. es integrante del grupo "La Parota" tiene 44 años de edad, estudio hasta la secundaria obteniendo su certificado, tiene 5 hijos, Bonifacio tiene 21 años y trabaja, Juan tiene 19 años ya se caso y trabaja, Antonio tiene 13 años estudia la secundaria, Gloria tiene 10 años estudia la primaria, Ana tiene 8 años estudia la primaria. Ella solicito su préstamo para comprar hilos y cierres para tener material para su taller industrial ya que ella maquila le mandan de Tétela del volcán los uniformes ya cortados y ella los cose y les da el terminado ya que los tiene listos de Tétela del volcán viene a recogerlos a su casa de quince a veinte días les entrega los uniformes ya terminados los van a entregar a San Luis Potosí y México. Ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años inicio cosiendo en maquina de pedal ya después se compra sus maquinas industriales pago el 50% al contado y la otra mitad las fue pagando con los créditos que le han proporcionado, ella confecciona uniformes de escuela, uniformes de policía, chalecos antibala, antimotín, y sus clientes de Jantetelco les confecciona sus vestidos de bailables para la escuela. Las ganancias del negocio las utilizan en la comida de sus hijos, para pagar los prestamos, para invertir en hilos y cierres.
Las integrantes del grupo son la señora **Tita Gloria A. M. va a comprar con su préstamo hilos, cierres, telas, etc. para sus costuras y dar mejor servicio a sus clientes, **la señora Amelia E. Jayesi va a comprar juegos de mesa para poner su juegos de video, **la señora Maria Geomara E. Aragón va a comprar conejos, alfalfa para criarlos y venderlos, **la Señora Jhanet Gutiérrez V. va a comprar verdura, pan, carne para hamburguesas, teleras etc., para su negocio de antojitos Mexicanos, **La señora Martina H. P. va a comprar ropa interior para vender se dedica a la venta por catalogo. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Que nos aumente el monto que nos prestan y nos bajen el interés para que nos ayuden a que crezcan los negocios”. A la señora Tita le ayudan a coser su hermana y su cuñado y le gustaría comprar otras 4 maquinas de cocer diferentes para realizar un trabajo con mejor terminado, el negocio es importante porque de ahí comemos y para mantener a sus hijos, su parte favorita de trabajar en el negocio es coser los uniformes y cuando le pagan, ella desea hacer un local mas grande para las maquina, sus sueños son ver a sus hijos grandes y que tengan su carrera. El pueblo de Jantetelco es un pueblo tranquilo, no hay problemas, elaboran dulce cristalizado, fruta de horno son galletitas tipo repostería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group, called La Parota, is located in Jantetelco, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It has 5 members who know each other and are neighbours. Miss Tita A. M. is a member of the La Parota group. She is 44 and studied up to high school, obtaining her certificate. She has 5 children: Bonifacio is 21 and works; Juan is 19, married and works; Antonio is 13 and in high school; Gloria is 10 and is in elementary school; and Ana is 8 and is in elementary school. Tita requested this loan for the purchase of thread and clasps to have material for her industrial workshop. She manufactures orders from Tétela del Volcán and takes pre-cut uniforms which she stitches and finishes up. Once they are ready, customers come from Tétela del Volcán to pick them up at her house. In 15 to 20 days she has finished uniforms for San Luis Potosí and México. She started her business 4 years ago, sewing on a pedal machine, and later she bought her industrial machines, paying 50% in cash. She has been paying the other half with loans that she has received. She makes school uniforms, police uniforms, bulletproof vests, and riot police uniforms. She makes clothing for school dances for her customers in Jantetelco. She uses her earnings for this business to feed her children, repay her loans, and invest in thread and clasps. The group members are Tita Gloria A. M., who will buy thread, clasps, fabric etc with her loan for her clothing, to provide better service; Amelia E. Jayesi, who will buy board games to put with her video games; Maria Geomara E. Aragón who will buy rabbits and alfalfa to raise and sell them; Jhanet Gutiérrez V., who will buy vegetables, bread, meat for hamburgers and teleras for her Mexican delicacy business; and Martina H. P., who will purchase underwear to sell through catalogues. The group m embers want to tell Kiva and Fundacion Realidad "to increase the amount you lend to us and lower our interest in order to help us expand our businesses". Tita's sister and brother-in-law help her to sew, and she would like to buy 4 other different machines to make better products. The business is important because this is how they eat and maintain their children. Her favourite part of working in this business is sewing the uniforms and getting paid. She wants to open a larger store for the machines. Her dreams are to see her children grown with careers. The village of Jantetelco is a peaceful village. There are no problems. They make crystallized candy and baked fruit which are small baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of thread, clasps, and fabrics for her clothes-making

loans.name: White Mountain Group

texts.es:
El señor Romeo González Gómez ,tiene treinta y dos años de edad, es casado con la señora, Martha Yessenia Aguilar Díaz, en donde apenas tiene una hija de dos años, Heidi yamileth en el cual se siente muy orgulloso de su familia.

   Solicito el préstamo para poner una tienda de abarrotes y poder   obtener ingresos en su hogar, trabajando el préstamo, para que con eso mismo pueda pagar puntualmente y siga perteneciendo en el programa.

   Lo que lo inspiro a esta actividad fue su familia poniendo una actividad donde su esposa este pendiente de la tienda y su hogar, mientras él trabaja  en el campo sembrando maíz para venderlo y así  juntos aporten en los gastos pequeños de su casa.

   Con lo que obtiene de su venta de toda la semana, compra más mercancía para que su tienda este cada día más surtida y con cosas de  mejor calidad. De eso mismos sus clientes le compren regular de mercancía, así obtener mejores ganancias y logre lo que quiere para su familia.

   Su sueño es que  pueda ahorrar para que su tienda de abarrotes se valla incrementando día con día, así darle lo mejor a su esposa e hija que son su razón de trabajar para que les pueda dar lo que más necesiten.
   
   Romeo se integro al grupo por una invitación que le hizo su padrino el señor Guillermo y quien es el 
representante a que formara parte del programa, se animo y hoy gracias al apoyo está logrando su objetivo. El grupo se llama cerro blanco la razón del nombre es porque por donde se ubica el grupo hay un cerro grande de piedras blancas.
    Los integrantes del grupo son cuatro señores  y cada uno con diferente actividad:

   
 Guillermo E. F.: invierte el préstamo para la compra y venta de quesos en la región.
 
Filadelfo M. Méndez: invierte el préstamo para la compra de materiales, para elaborar block como son: cemento y arena.
 
Porfirio E. F.: se dedica a comprar quesos para venderlo en la misma región, así también compra leche para elaborarlo y le sea más fácil.
 
Romeo González Gómez: invierte el  préstamo en la copra de mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes como son: azúcar, aceite, frijol, huevo, galletas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Romeo G. G. is thirty two years old, he is married with Martha Yessenia Aguilar Diaz and they have a two year old daughter, Heidi Yamileth. He is very proud of his family. He requests a loan to set up a grocery store and to have a source of income for his family. Working in this business will allow him to make his payments on time and keep up as a participant in the program. His inspiration is his family. He wanted to have a business that his wife will be able to manage in their house while he goes to the fields to care for their corn plantations.
