Together they will be able to cover the household expenses. With his weekly earnings he purchases more merchandise for the store so that every day the variety is replenished and the quality of the products improved. His goal is to have clients come to purchase merchandise regularly and therefore obtain better earnings and be able to provide his family with what they need. His dream is to save enough funds so that their grocery store will improve day by day, and to provide only the best to his wife and daughter. They are the reason for his hard work. Romeo became part of the group following an invitation from his godfather, Guillermo. He is a representative of the program and he became interested. It is thanks to their support that he has attained his goals. The group's name is White Mountain, a name that reflects where the group meets. It is next to a mountain of white rocks. The group is made up of four men, each carries out a different business: Guillermo E. F.: will invest the loan in the purcase of cheeses in the region. Fidadelfo M. M.: will invest the loan in the purchase materials to make building blocks (cement and sand). Porfirio E. F.: he will purchase cheeses to resell in the region and to purchase milk to make cheeses. Romeo G. G.: he will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise for his grocery store: sugar, cooking oil, beans, eggs, cookies, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: la compra de mercancia para surtier su tienda de abarrotes como son: azucar, huevo, aceite, frijo, entre otros.

loans.name: Santurios Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es Santurios, llamados así por que les gusta ese tipo de flor, está conformado por once integrantes, ellos radican en la Comunidad de San Isidro en Valle de Chalco, Estado de México. Los integrantes son: Rosalva O. S. (Venta de Antojitos), Verónica Rosario González P. (Venta de Zapatos), Silvia C. Hernández (Venta de Queso) Eulalia Ester González Q. (Abarrotes), María Dominga González P. (Venta de Zapatos), Lourdes O. Martínez (Papelería), Leonor Raquel C. G. (Venta de Cosméticos), Margarito Antonio Báez J. (Venta de Papaya), Félix C. Martínez (Venta de frutas y Legumbres), Juan A. Y. (Venta de Frutas y Legumbres) y Joel Martínez N. (Venta de Papayas).

Rosalva O. S. es integrante de Santurios, tiene 37 años de edad, su familia está integrada por su esposo y sus tres hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Anteriormente Rosa trabajaba asiendo limpieza, pero con el tiempo los gastos de su familia fueron incrementado y el sueldo de su esposos en ocasiones no era suficiente así que decidió ayudar y comenzar con una actividad económica que le diera un ingreso mas. Actualmente se dedica la venta de Cosméticos, Antojitos y Venta de Ropa en general, va ofreciendo en las casas y en la escuela donde sus hijos asisten ya que ahí conoce a mucha gente y no pierde la oportunidad de poder vender, le va muy bien en sus ventas  y ahorita en el mes de diciembre es cuando incrementa un poco mas, siempre trata de tener variedad y de dar buenos precios para mantener a la clientela que tiene, se surte cada ocho días ya que aprovecha que la mercancía se la llevan hasta su domicilio así que no gasta en transporte. Con el crédito solicitado comprara mercancía como: blusas, pantalones, playeras, chamarras, etc., para poder incrementar sus ganancias. Sus planes de Rosa son poder brindarles un buen futuro a sus hijos y que no les falte nada para su buen desarrollo.

Agradecen el apoyo de Kiva a través de fundación Realidad y de que apoyen a la gente para que puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is called Santurios because they like this type of flower. It is made up of eleven members. They live in the San Isidro community in Valle de Chalco, Estado de Mexico. The members are: Rosalva O. S. (Luxury Item Sales), Verónica Rosario González P. (Shoe Sales), Silvia C. Hernández (Cheese Sales) Eulalia Ester González Q. (Groceries), María Dominga González P. (Shoe Sales), Lourdes O. Martínez (Stationery Store), Leonor Raquel C. G. (Cosmetics Sales), Margarito Antonio Báez J. (Papaya Sales), Félix C. Martínez (Fruit and Vegetable Sales), Juan A. Y. (Fruit and Vegetable Sales) y Joel Martínez N. (Papaya Sales). Rosalva O. S. is a member of Santurios. She is 37. Her family is made up of her husband and three school-aged children. Rosa previously worked as a cleaner, but with time her family's costs kept increasing and their salaries were not enough at times. She decided to fix this and start a business that would give her a greater income. She now sells cosmetics, luxury items and clothing in general. She offers her products in homes and in the school that her children attend, since she knows many people there and never passes up the chance to sell. Sales are very good and December is the month in which they increase a little more. She always tries to have variety and good prices to keep her customers. She stocks up every eight days and benefits from the fact that the merchandise is brought to her home, so she does not have to spend money on transportation. With the requested loan she will purchase merchandise such as: blouses, pants, t-shirts, jackets, etc., in order to increase her earnings. Rosa's plans are to be able to offer a better future to her children, and that they will lack nothing for their proper development. She is grateful for the support of Kiva through Fundación Realidad, and for their support of people so that they can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of clothing, fruits, vegetables, shoes, cosmetics, and groceries

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: The Winds Group

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Cristina González M., vive en coapilla Estado de  Chiapas México, es casada con señor Emilio Díaz Pérez, en el cual procrearon tres hijos dos varones y una mujer, Deysi que ya está casada Daniel de diesi seis años de edad en tercer semestre de preparatoria, y el más pequeño es wilder Iván de quince años.

       Ella se dedica a su hogar y a la actividad de  elaborar antojitos como son comida y tamales, desde hace dos años, donde comenta que le va bien ya que con eso ha logrado a horrar y  empezar a construir,  una casa más amplia para poner una tienda de abarrotes para que con eso obtenga ingresos para su hogar.

  Lo que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad de vender comida y tamales fue su familia para aportar y cubrir los gastos de sus hijos que están estudiando, a un así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja del diario para que juntos aporten y saquen adelante a su familia.

   Con las ganancias que   obtiene de su venta, ha estado ahorrando para trabajarlo y con ello comprar los ingredientes para elaborarlos con mejor calidad y los clientes se interesen en consumir sus antojitos.

   Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa para que ya pueda tener su tienda de abarrotes que es lo que más desea tener y con ello sacar adelante a sus hijos para que terminen una carrera donde ellos de pendan para vivir.

  Formo parte del grupo ya que su mama la señora María Luisa la invito a participar y Solicitar un préstamo para trabajarlo en sus actividades. El grupo se llama las brisas le pusieron ese nombre ya que cuando se izo la solicitud estaba bisando.

  Las personas que integran el grupo son tres señoras muy trabajadoras y son las siguientes:
 
  Belén M. P.: invierte el préstamo  en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes como son: harina, aceite, huevo, entre otros.
  María Luisa M. Pérez: invierte el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para la elaboración de panes como son: aceite, huevo, harina, aceite, leña, entre otros.
  Isabel Cristina Gonzales M.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar comidas y tamales.
texts.en:
Isabel Cristina G. M. lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas in Mexico. She is married with Emilio Diaz P.. Together they had three children, two are boys and one is a girl. Dyesi is already married. Daniel is sixteen years old and he is in grade 9. And the youngest is Wilder Ivan and he is 15 years old. She runs her house and she has had a catering business for the past two years, making snacks and tamales. The business has been successful and she has managed to put away some savings and start building a larger house. Her goal is to set up a store in the house to obtain another source of income for the household. The reason for her catering business is her family. She wishes to support them and be able to pay the school tuition for her children. She sees support from her husband who works daily, so that together they can support the family. With the earnings obtained from her sales she has been saving money and she reinvests back into the business, purchasing ingredients to make quality foods to keep her clients interested and always coming back. Her dream is to finish building her house so that they will be able to have their grocery store, what she most wishes to have. She will be able to provide for her children and see them have careers and make their own living. She joined the group after her mother Maria Luisa invited her to participate and request a loan for her business. The group is named The Winds, a name that was chosen because it was a windy day when the group formed. The individuals that make up the group are three very hard working women: Belen M. P.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients to make breads (flour, cooking oil, eggs, etc.) Maria Luisa M. P.: she will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make breads (cooking oil, eggs, flour, firewood etc.) Isabel Cristina Gonzales Moralez: she will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients to prepare foods and tamales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare foods and tamales, such as: chicken, vegetables, seafood, meat, cooking oil, flour etc.

loans.name: San Nicolas Group

texts.es: Este  grupo solidario se llama San Nicolás, está ubicado en Barrio San Nicolás Tlalnepantla, en el estado de Morelos, México. Está conformado por 5 integrantes mujeres que son vecinas y se conocen ya de tiempo. La señora Herminia R. M.  es integrante del grupo tiene 57 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto año de primaria, ella se dedica al comercio vender fruta de temporada y solicito su préstamo para comprar frutas  aguacate, durazno, míspero y chirimoya vende su mercancía en el mercado de Xochimilco, es un mercado grande que llegan a surtirse muchas personas, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de cómo 20 puestos formados  que venden los mismos productos y vende quien tiene suerte. Las integrantes del grupo son la señora  Guadalupe Ávila M. va a comprar con su préstamo abono orgánico por camión torton para fertilizar su sembradío de nopal, la señora Leticia L. C. va a pagar el servicio de renta de motocultor, deshierbado y picado de nopal. La señora Marquelia R. Días va a comprar producto de perfumes por kit paquete que contiene perfumes, labiales, rubor, la señora Herminia R. M. va a comprar fruta de temporada, aguacate, durazno, chirimoya por caja, la señora Leocadia Z. N. va a comprar mercancía refrescos por caja, detergente, jabón, azúcar. Ellas quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación realidad “Gracias por la ayuda que nos prestan el dinero y que nos sigan apoyando con más prestamos”. La señora Herminia Inicio con el negocio de venta de Frutas hace 25 años, su suegra le enseño a vender y así aprendió se iba a vender del diario con poquito y vio que me iba bien y le fue metiendo mas frutas ahora las compra por caja. Las frutas las compra en Yecapixtla, el aguacate por caja. Para llegar a su negocio se hace hora y media, en Tlalnepantla toma el camión que la deja en el mercado de Xochimilco, ella quiere ahorrar para comprar un carrito para no pagar pasaje y no levantar las cajas pesadas, está bien contenta con el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir comprando las frutas para surtir su negocio que es popular por tener 30 años vendiendo en el mercado de Xochimilco, su esposo le ayuda a vender los sábados y domingos que es cuando hay más clientes, atiende a  40 personas aproximadamente en 1 hora ya después se vende más despacio y cuando está muy lluvioso a veces no se vende. Ella desea mejorar su vivienda repellarla, echarle colado y ponerle puertas y ventanas. El pueblo de Tlalnepantla está muy bonito no hay ruido, no hay smog y es tranquilo se ven los cerros, los plantíos de nopal, mísperos y ciruelos.
texts.en:
This supportive group is called San Nicolás and is located in the neighborhood of San Nicolás Tlalnepantla, in the State of Morelos in México. It is composed of five members who already knew each other well since they are neighbors. Sra. Herminia M. R. is one of the members of the group. She is 57 years old and has a 5th grade education. She sells seasonal fruit and is asking for a loan to buy fruit such as avocados, peaches, sapodilla, and cherimoya. Herminia sells her merchandise in the Xochimilco market, which is a large market where many people come to stock up on goods. Her business faces competition from 20 other stalls that are trained to sell the same products so some luck is involved. Sra. Herminia started her business of selling fruit 25 years ago. Her mother-in-law taught her to sell by starting with newspapers, and she learned gradually. Her mother-in-law saw that she was doing well and was now selling more fruit that she had to buy them wholesale. She buys the fruit and avocados in Yecapixtla. To get to her business, it takes an hour and a half. In Tlalnepantla, she takes the bus that drops her off in the Xochimilco market. She wants to save to buy a cart to avoid paying bus fare and to avoid lifting heavy boxes. Herminia is pleased with the loan that she will invest in buying fruit for her business, which is popular after 30 years of selling in the Xochimilco market. Her husband helps her sell on Saturdays and Sundays which is when there are more customers. She serves approximately 40 people an hour and then it slows down. When it is very rainy, sometimes she doesn’t sell at all. She wants to improve her home by putting in plaster, pouring in concrete, and putting in doors and windows. The village of Tlalnepantla is very nice and peaceful. There isn’t any smog and you can see the hills, plantations of prickly pear, sapodilla, and plums. The members of the group are as follows: • Sra. Guadalupe Ávila M. will use the loan to buy organic fertilizer by the truckload to fertilize her sown fields of nopal (edible cactus). • Sra. Leticia L. C. will pay a rental service for a motocultor (rototiller with trailer), weeding, and cactus removal. • Sra. Marquelia R. Días will buy perfume for kit packages containing perfumes, lipsticks, and blush. • Sra. Herminia M. R. will buy seasonal fruit, avocado, peaches, and cherimoya wholesale. • Sra. Leocadia Z. N. will buy drinks wholesale, detergent, soap, and sugar. The members of the group would like to tell Kiva and field partner FRAC, “Thank you for the help and loans that you have provided. We hope that you can continue supporting us with more loans.”

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit for her business: avocados, peaches, sapodilla, cherimoya

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha de 31 años,  vive en el Fortín una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales. Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la casa de sus padres. 

Ella comenzó con su tienda en el 2005 desde que le dieron una parte de una herencia y toda la invirtió en readecuar su casa para ubicar una pequeña tienda, se levanta todos los días desde las 05h30am cuando sus tres hijos se vana a la escuela y después abre la tienda. Vende todo tipo de víveres como arroz, azúcar, aceites etc.   

Para surtir mas su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, pañales y un congelador para las carnes. En el futuro quiere tener otro negocio para poder asegurar la economía de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha, age 31, lives in El Fortin, an area known for its dirt roads and informal vendors. She runs a small general store from her parents' home.

She started her business in 2005, when she was given an inheritance, which she then invested in remodeling the house to set up her small shop. She wakes up every day at 5:30 in the morning, when her three children go to school. She then opens her shop in which she sells all types of provisions like rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

In order to better stock her shop, she would like to purchase rice, diapers, and a meat freezer with this loan. In the future, she would like to open up another business in order to ensure a steady income for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, diapers, and a freezer

loans.name: Cristal Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Cristal, esta ubicado en Moyotepec, CD. Ayala, en el Estado de Morelos, México, esta integrado por 6 mujeres entusiastas que se conocen ya de tiempo por ser vecinas. Las integrantes del grupo son Tomasa C. R.  va a comprar con su préstamo mercancía refrescos por caja, galletas por caja, dulces por kilo, la señora Hortencia Domínguez Ramírez va a comprar dulces por kilo, galletas por caja y refrescos por caja para surtir su negocio, la señora Antonia P. A. va a comprar un bote tamalero, una cazuela grande, gas, para preparar sus tamales, la señora Leticia T. Martínez va a comprar sillas para tener para rentar mas y dar mejor servicio, la señora Gabriela Domínguez Ramírez va a comprar ropa de bebe, conjuntos, playeras, calcetas, zapatitos y muñecos de peluche para regalo, la señora Lidia Juárez Núñez va a comprar material peluche, relleno, esponja, hilos, tovenita, plantillas etc. para elaborar las pantuflas. Ellas quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por echarnos la mano, para que sigamos con nuestros proyectos y tengamos los medios para apoyar a la familia”. La señora Lidia Juárez Núñez es integrante del grupo Cristal, tiene 38 años de edad, estudio hasta la secundaria, ella tiene su certificado, tiene 2 hijos Nadia Vianey tiene 19 años y trabaja en el negocio le ayuda en la elaboración de las pantuflas y Ricardo tiene 17 años estudia el CBTIS. La señora Lidia solicito su préstamo para ampliar su negocio, va a comprar material peluche, esponja, plástico, plantillas para elaborar las pantuflas, su negocio esta a bordo de la carretera  tiene poco espacio, esta en su casa en Moyotepec , ella quiere ampliar su taller tener mas espacio para trabajar abrir otra cortina, sus clientes son las personas que pasan por la carretera con sus vehículos ven las pantuflas y les gustan se llevan 3 o 4 pares, también las personas que viven aquí en Moyotepec pasan y les gusta hay veces que le encargan el color de su preferencia, ella ofrece a su clientela pantuflas, peluches, cojines, perfumes. Ella inicio su negocio hace 5 años, estuvo trabajando en una fabrica que elabora pantuflas y aprendió, ahora ella las elabora compra el material tiene 2 maquinas rectas 1 la compro ella y otra la compro su esposo, considera importante su negocio por que de ahí va solventando los gastos, compro su maquina recta y para ayudar a sus hijos en el estudio y se siente orgullosa por que ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, para el estudio de su hijo no tiene que conseguir para las inscripciones toma dinero de lo que tiene del negocio. Su hija le ayuda en la elaboración de las pantuflas corta las piezas y les da el terminado las decora le pone los ojos, la nariz, etc. cuando tiene mucho trabajo también le ayuda su esposo cose las piezas en temporadas de frió que es cuando se vende mas aumenta la producción. La señora Lidia esta muy contenta con el préstamo que le proporcionan le ayudan a darle vida a su negocio le va a invertir mas, va a aumentar su producción, las mejoras que espera realizar para sus hijos  que tengan su propio espacio quiere hacer mas recamaras, también que crezca su negocio y darle trabajo a alguien que le ayude con el trabajo. Las ganancias que obtiene las vuelve a invertir, va ahorrando y para los gastos de su casa. Le gusta la localidad de Moyotepec es muy tranquilo, de clima templado cuanta con todos los servicios.
texts.en:
This support group is called Cristal. It is located in Moyotepec, CD. Ayala, in the state of Morelos, México. It is made up of 6 enthusiastic women who have known other for some time as neighbors. The members of the group are Tomasa C. R., who is going to buy beverage merchandise by the case, cookies by the box, and candies by the kilo; Hortencia Domínguez Ramírez, who is going to buy candies by the kilo, cookies by the box, and beverages by the case to supply her business; Antonia P. A. is going to buy a tamale cooker, a large pot, and natural gas to make her tamales; Leticia T. Martínez is going to buy chairs to rent out more and give better service; Gabriela Domínguez Ramírez is going to buy baby clothes, outfits, t-shirts, slippers, flip-flops and stuffed dolls for gifts; Lidia Juárez Núñez is going to buy materials for stuffed animals such as filling, foam, thread, tovena, and insoles, etc. to make slippers. They want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad “thank you for giving us a hand, so that we can go ahead with our projects and have the means to support our families." Lidia Juárez Núñez is amember of the Cristal group. She is 38 years old and she went to school up until middle school. She has her certificate. She has 2 children, Nadia Vianey, 19, who works in the business helping her make slippers, and Ricardo, 17, who studies at CBTIS. Lidia asked for her loan to enlarge her business. She is going to buy materials for stuffed animals such as foam and plastic, as well as insoles to make slippers. Her business in next to the highway and has little space. It is in her house in Moyotepec. She wants to enlarge her workshop and have more space to work and open another curtain. Her customers are people who pass by on the highway in their cars who see the slippers and like them enough to take 3 or 4 pairs. People who live here in Moyotepec pass by and like them as well. Sometimes they order the color of their preference. She offers her customers slippers, stuffed animals, cushions and perfumes. She started her business 5 years ago. She was working in a factory that makes slippers and she learned how. Now she makes them. She buys the fabric. She has two sewing machines, one she bought and one her husband bought. She considers her business to be important because with it she pays the family expenses. She bought her sewing machine to help her children's studies and she feels proud that she has been able to get her children ahead. She doesn't have to borrow for her children's school fees, she uses the money from her business. Her daughter helps her make the slippers. She cuts the pieces and she finishes them. She puts on the eyes, the nose, etc. When she has a lot of work, her husband helps as well. He sews the pieces when it's cold out, which is when they sell more and ramp up production. Lidia is very happy with the loan which will give her help to enliven her business. She is going to invest more in it and increase production. She hopes to make the improvements for her children, so that they can have their own space. She wants to make more bedrooms, and she also wants to grow her business and give work to someone who can help with the work. She will re-invest the earnings, and she will save for her household expenses. She likes the community of Moyotepec. It is very calm, has a good climate, and has all services.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for stuffed animals, filling, foam, thread, tovena  and insoles.

loans.name: Campo Verde (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La  señora  María Antonia Gómez P., vive en coapilla estado de Chiapas México, fue casada en donde procreo dos hijos: elariceli  de diecisiete años y francisco Javier de veintidós años de edad y quien cada uno ya están casado.

     Ella  se dedica  a la elaboración de tamales y tostadas con crema , desde hace cuatro años, el cual comenta que le va muy bien desde que inicio con esta actividad ya que hay personas  que le compran sus tamales y tostadas por mayoreo, con lo que ha podido notar que obtiene buenos ingresos en su hogar.

     Cometa que ella decidió hacer este tipo de negocio, para aportar en los gastos de la casa y estar al pendiente de su familia, ya que durante unos años trabajo en casas como empleada domestica para sostener a sus hijos.

    Con la ganancia que obtiene de sus dos negocios compra ingredientes para los tamales, como son maíz, aceite, carne, pasas, y para la tostada la crema, en ello lo vuelve lo vuelve a invertir  para que siga trabajando sin ningún problema, así también pueda ahorrar para pagar el préstamo que fundación realidad a.c le ha otorgado.

     Su sueño de Antonia es que construya una concina de block para que pueda  elaborar su actividad ya que donde lo hace hasta ahora es de tablas y el viento no la deja avanzar. Lo que ella también quisiera es que con esta actividad cambie sus condiciones de vida y pueda salir adelante.
  
     Formo parte del grupo por una promoción que se izo en su pueblo, el cual la representante del grupo Rosaura se intereso y platico con ella para que se integrara a ellas. El grupo se llama campo verde la razón del nombre es porque el lugar donde se ubica el grupo son lomas y planadas de zacate verde.

Los integrantes del grupo campo verde (flat) son las siguientes:

   Antonia Gómez P.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales y tostadas.

   Rosaura M. S.: invierte el préstamo para la compra de catálogos de cosméticos como son: perfumes, cremas, esmaltes entre otros.

  Amelia P. T.: invierte el préstamo para la compra de maíz, para elaborar tortillas echas ámanos y venderlo en el mismo pueblo.
texts.en:
María Antonia Gómez P. lives in Coapila in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She was married and has two children out of that marriage: Elariceli, age 17, and Francisco Javier, age 22. Both are married. Maria has made tamales and toast with cream in bulk for four years. She makes good income from her home. She says that she decided to do this type of business to help out with her household costs and tend to her family. Before, she worked in houses as a maid to support her children. With the earnings from her business she buys ingredients for the tamales, such as corn, oil, meat, and raisins; and for the toast she buys cream. Thus, she re-invests in order to keep working without any problems. This way she is also able to save to repay this loan from Fundacion Realidad A.C. Antonia's dream is to build a solid kitchen so that she can better do her job, since currently she just has planks and the wind does not allow her to progress. She would also like for this job to change her living conditions so that she can get ahead. They made this group because of a promotion in their village. Rosaura is the group representative. They were interested in her and asked her to join them. The group is called Campo Verde ["Green Field"] because in the area the group is located there are hills and spaces of green grass. The members of Campo Verde (flat) are the following: Antonia Gómez P.: will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients for making tamales and toast Rosaura M. S.: will invest the loan in the purchase of cosmetics catalogues for items such as: perfumes, creams and nail polishes, among other items Amelia P. T.: will invest the loan in the purchase of corn, to make tortillas that she cooks and sells in the same village.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of ingredients to make tamales such as: dough, banana leaf, and dried chilli, among others

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo en el Barrio San Juan de la Zona Sur de la cuidad de Fernando de la Mora  por medio de otro grupo que trabaja en la misma zona, el comité cuenta actualmente con 13 integrantes todas vecinas entre si. 
Hablaremos de Bettina Arminda G. R. D. quien es la Directora del Comité, ella  tiene 40 años, es divorciada, tiene 2 hijos (dos varones, uno de 9años y 4 años ,respectivamente)vive con la madre la Señora Arminda R. D. desde hace 2 años. 
S e dedica a la venta de Ropas  para mujer, hombres y niños, por lo general sobre pedidos.
Bettina viaja constantemente a Buenos Aires adquirir prendas de moda para damas, como jeans, blusas.
Luego con la ayuda de su madre venden las prendas basicamente en contado o en ocasiones en cuotas a los vecinos o parientes (gente conocida).
Ella desea ampliar su negocio comprando calzados deportivos para la venta pues eso deja más ganancias.
Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien un profesión.
texts.en:
This committee was founded in the Barrio San Juan in the southern part of the city of Fernando de la Mora, with the help of another group working in the same area. It now has 13 members, all of whom are neighbors. Bettina Arminda G. R. D. is the committee's director. She is 40 years old, divorced, and has two children (two boys, who are 9 and 4 respectively). She has lived with her mother, Arminda R. D., since she was two. Bettina sells women's, men's, and children's clothes, usually on request. She frequently travels to Buenos Aires to get garments for women, such as jeans and blouses. Then, with her mother's help, she sells the clothes to acquaintances, neighbors, and relatives. She would like to increase her business by buying sports shoes to sell, as this will raise her income. She wants her children to study and have a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sports shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase cement, blocks, and paint

loans.name: Edwin Omar

texts.es:
el sr. Edwin Omar C. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la Colonia las Delicias Trojes El Paraiso, Edwin se dedica a la elaboracion de bloques para casas o muros. tiene varios años de decicarse a este tipo de actividad.
tiene mucha experiencia en hacer los bloques.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar cemento y arena al por mayor para fabricar los bloques, en estos momentos tiene un gran pedido y no tiene el suficiente capital para invertirlo en su negocio.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Edwin Omar C. is 38 years old and lives in the Las Delicias Trojes housing development of El Paraiso. Edwin makes cinder blocks for homes and walls for a living. He has been in business for several years and has acquired much experience.

He will use this loan in order to purchase wholesale cement and sand so that he can make blocks. At this time, he has a big order to fill, but he does not have enough capital to invest in his business.

He needs these profits in order to help his family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase block making materials

loans.name: Grimaneza

texts.es:
Grimaneza tiene 50 años de edad y vive en el caserío Guaraguaos Alto del distrito de Tambogrande junto a sus tres hijos, actualmente se encuentra separada de su conyugue. La zona en donde vive es una zona agrícola que produce principalmente mango, limón y maracuyá. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y prendas de vestir en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. El negocio le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia durante todo este tiempo. Diariamente se esfuerza por sacarlo adelante brindando un buen trato y productos de calidad a sus clientes. Gracias a ello se ha vuelto conocida en el rubro y su establecimiento siempre cuenta con clientela fija.

Grimaneza desea ampliar su bodega con la compra de mas productos de primera necesidad de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia. Por este motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer luchadora y que da todo de si para sacar adelante a sus hijos, las personas que le conocen en la zona donde vive le consideran una mujer tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Grimaneza is 50 and lives in the hamlet of Guaraguaos Alto in the Tambogrande district with her three children. She is currently separated from her spouse. The zone where she lives is an agricultural zone that mainly produces mango, lemon and passion fruit. It belongs to the Piura province and is located in the region of the same name, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Grimaneza sells basic staples and clothing items in a small store in her home. The business has allowed her to get her family ahead during this time. She makes an effort every day to make the store succeed, offering good service and quality products to her customers. Thanks to this, she has become known in the area and her establishment always has loyal customers. Grimaneza wants to expand her store with the purchase of more basic staples in order to increase her sales and make more income, which will allow her to get her family ahead. For this reason she has decided to request her first loan, 1000 soles, with Edyme Alternativa. She is a hard-working woman who gives all of herself to get her children ahead. Those who know her in the area where she lives consider her to be a calm and reliable woman.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of basic staples and groceries to expand the store in her home

loans.name: Rafel

texts.es: Rafael, de 28 años, es un hombre muy sincero y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Nancy de 26 años y sus 2 queridos hijas Romina de 6 y Tais de 5 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy joven Rafael aprendió a trabajar con la tierra, ya que la agricultura es la actividad que siempre a estado presente en su vida, actualmente el tiene sus propias tierras donde cultiva papa, olluco y arveja, productos que después de la cosecha lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rafael, age 28, is a very sincere and happy man. He lives in his own home with his wife Nancy, age 28, and his 2 beloved daughters Romina, age 6, and Tais, age 5. He wants to offer them a better quality of life. From a very young age, Rafael learned to work with the land, since agriculture is the occupation that has always been part of his life. He now has his own land where he cultivates potatoes, ullucos and peas. After the harvest, he brings them to sell in the wholesale market of Tarma city. His favourite part of his job is cultivating his lands, since this is the activity that feeds his family. He has been doing this work for 8 years, and he finds his greatest difficulty to be keeping his crops safe from the plague of insects. With time, he wants to buy new lands to increase his production. This is his fifth loan with MFP. He has always been very punctual with his payments and he hopes to be so now as well. In his community bank he is a very supportive of the rest of the members. With the 1000 soles that he is requesting, he will purchase more manure and fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco está casado desde hace 20 años, tiene 2 hijos menores a su cargo. El se dedica a la venta de mercadería general y ofrece el servicio de disco móvil,  el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su vivienda  de esta manera puede aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a con los gastos del hogar. El manifiesta que la única forma de crecimiento es a través de los créditos, porque le resulta muy difícil conseguir acumular el capital operativo. Razón por el cual necesita el crédito para la compra de ropas como remeras, camisas, vestidos, pantalones y otros. El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que vaya a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
José Francisco has been married for 20 years and has two children under his care. He sells general goods and also offers mobile disc jockey services. His business is located inside his house, thus he is able to increase his income and help with the household expenses. He states that the only way for his business to grow is via these loans because it is very difficult for him to accumulate enough working capital. For this reason, he needs this loan to purchase T-shirts, shirts, dresses, pants, and other merchandise. He is a very responsible person who has the desire for self-improvement. He is a cheerful and enterprising man who will no doubt achieve all the goals that he has set for himself.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es: Rosalbina tiene 42 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Bernardo de 48 años y sus 2 hijos menores Kevin de 16 y Ketty de 13 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos días de trabajo que Rosalbina tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras. Junto al mayor de sus hijos trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, sembrando papa y arveja, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar y ver como sus plantas van creciendo, lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar la cantidad de su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una social muy alegre, motivo por el cual es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosalbina is 42. She is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Bernardo, age 48, and their 2 young children, Kevin, 16, and Ketty, 13, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life. The arduous days of work that Rosalbina passes on her small farm have served to improve her harvests and make her lands more productive. She works with her oldest child, starting very early in the morning, sowing potatoes and peas. She later brings these products to sell in the wholesale market in Tarma city. Her favourite part of her job is cultivating, and seeing how her plants grow. She has been doing this work for 27 years and she finds the greatest challenge to be keeping her fields safe from insect plagues. With time, she hopes to buy more land and thus expand her production. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She was very punctual with the payment of her quotas in her first loan, and she hopes to be so again. In her community bank she is a very happy member, which is why she is very well-liked by the rest of her peers. With the 1500 soles that she is requesting, she will purchase more fertilizer to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer

loans.name: Griselda Azucena

texts.es:
Griselda D. 45 años, tiene una pequeña papelería en L. parte delantera D. su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral, tiene dos hijos D. 15 y 13 años. 

Inicio con L. motivación D. su esposo ya que el antes D. casarse tenia una tienda pero debido a L. falta D. oportunidades tubo que comenzar con mas actividades. Ahora los dos trabajan en su papelería desD. las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm y pasan mas tiempo con sus hijos. Venden cada cuadernos a $ 1.25, perfumes a $ 27.00 etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio surtido elL. quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos. En el futuro quiere termina D. construir su casa y tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Griselda, age 45, has a small stationery store in the front section of her house. She lives in a peri-urban zone called Perimetral and has two children ages 15 and 13.

She got started because of her husband's motivation to do so. Before getting married, she used to own a shop, but had to pursue other activities due to a lack of business opportunities. They now both work at their stationery store from 7:00am until 7:00pm, and they are able to spend more time with their children. They sell notebooks for $1.25 and perfumes for $27.00, etc.

In order to keep their business well-stocked, she would like to purchase more notebooks with this loan. In the future, she would like to finish building her house and to start another business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks and pens

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana sells men's clothing at one of the markets in Melitopol city and has been in this business for thirteen years. She has always tried to offer her clients a large variety of clothing at affordable prices. Tatyana is married with two children and her clothing business is the only source of income for her family. She uses the profit to support her family and also her parents’ family to enable them to survive economically. Tatyana has used Kiva loans before (see here) and found them very helpful for her business. This time, she would like to borrow 20,000 Grivnas to increase her inventory of seasonable clothing.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas Group

texts.es:
el grupo mujeres divinas esta ubicado en la colonia Nueva Caucara de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, este grupo esta integrado por tres mujeres, vecinas y que se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo, ellas se dedican al comercio y son mujeres muy humildes pero con un gran deseo de superacion, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

doña Arlis N. A. tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella, Arlis se dedica a la comercializacion de productos para la canasta familiar como ser: harina de maiz, arroz, jabon, azucar, pollo, mantequilla, chorizos extremeños, jugos, etc. esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años en su casa de habitacion, el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas abarroteria y asi surtir su pulperia.

Francis Orestila se dedica a la compra y venta de achineria junto con su esposo. Francis tiene tres hijos que dependen de ellos, Francis tiene casa propia, sus productos los vende en la frontera del Amatillo Honduras-El Salvador, ahi las ventas son en dolares.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de achineria.

la sra. Dilcia Mabel A. A. tiene 29 años de edad, tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella,  su actividad economica es la venta de ropa usada clasificada, la distribuye en las aldeas y barrios de San Lorenzo.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar fardo de ropa usada.

el sueño de estas mujeres es tener una buena educacion para sus hijos y sobre todo tener éxito en todo lo que hacen.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Divinas (Divine Women) Group is located in the Nueva Caucara housing development of the city of San Lorenzo. This group is comprised of three women, all neighbors who have known each other for a long time. They all own businesses and are very humble women with the desire for self-improvement. Next, details will be given regarding the different businesses that these women own.

Ms. Arlis N. A. is a 34-year-old married mother with three dependent children. Arlis sells provisions such as cornmeal, rice, soap, sugar, chicken, butter, Extremaduran chorizo (seasoned pork sausage), juice, etc. She has been running this business from her home for several years. This loan will be used to purchase more goods so that she can restock her general store.

Ms. Francis Orestila and her husband buy and sell trinkets for a living. Francis has three dependent children and her own home. She sells her products at the Honduran-Salvadoran border in Amatillo, where transactions are made in dollars. She will use the loan to purchase knickknacks.

Ms. Dilcia Mabel A. A. is a 29-year-old mother of three dependent children. She sells sorted used clothing, distributing it in the hamlets and neighborhoods of San Lorenzo. She will use this loan to purchase a bundle of used clothing.

These women dream of being able to provide their children with a good education, but above all, they hope that their children are successful in whatever they do.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase knickknacks, provisions, and used clothing

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 48 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Clemente de 58 años y sus 5 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Teodosia ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva papa y arveja, productos que luego lleva a vender a la ciudad de Tarma, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para aumentar su productividad.
texts.en:
Teodosia, age 48, is a very unassuming and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Clement, age 58, and their 5 young children, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life. With a lot of effort, Teodisa has been able to work her lands and make them very productive. She cultivates potatoes and peas, products which she later brings to sell in Tarma city, where she sells them wholesale. Her crops have provided her the necessary income to maintain her family. For this reason she wants to put all of her earnings into getting this business ahead. Her favourite part of her work is caring for her crops. She has been doing this work for 35 years, and she finds her greatest difficulty to be transporting her products to the wholesale market in Tarma, since the bags that she brings are very heavy and make her very tired. In the future, she hopes to improve her crops and thus to have more income. This is her third loan with MFP. She has been very punctual in her previous loans and she hopes to be so again. In her community bank, she is a very participatory member and is always aware of the agreements that the group reaches. With the 700 soles that she is requesting, she will purchase fertilizer to increase her productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Blanza Flor

texts.es:
Blanca Flor es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío Guaraguaos del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola caracterizada principalmente por producir frutas que son exportadas a diversos países del exterior. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la region del mismo nombre, y se encuentra ubicada a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, en especial ovejas, ella cría a sus animales en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, las suele alimentar de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de estas actividades ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos familiares.

Blanca desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentacion de sus animales de modo que se puedan desarrollar de mejor manera y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive, las personas que le conocen  le consideran una mujer tranquila y entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca Flor is a 52-year-old mother who lives with her husband and son in the Guaraguaos hamlet in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area that is known for its product of fruit that is exported to several different countries. This area is a part of the Piura province, in the region by the same name, and it is located over 3.5 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She raises and sells animals, especially sheep, for a living. She raises her livestock in a corral in her backyard. She usually feeds them natural grains and grass. When the sheep have adequately grown, she sells them to buyers in the area. With the profits earned from the business, she helps her husband, who is a farmer, with the family expenses.

Blanca would like to obtain balanced feed in order to improve her livestock's nutrition so that they can grow better and be sold at a higher price. In order to be able to do this, she feels that it is fitting to request a 1,000 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time.

She is a rather well-known and esteemed woman in the area, and people who know her consider her to be a calm woman who is devoted to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build a gallery/workshop

loans.name: Reina Mercedes

texts.es: Reina Mercedes tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de comida. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, ella dio inicio por medio de su hermana que le enseño este medio vida pues ella tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, pues ella ha realizado muchos sacrificios para salir adelante con este negocio, por lo que la mayoría de sus vecinos  y amigos asisten a comprar los diferentes platillos que ofrece. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceites, bebidas y verduras. Para el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y expandir su negocio
texts.en:
Reina Mercedes, age 31, sells food. She has had this business for over two years. She started through her sister, who taught her this way of earning a living. She has one child under her care. She has made many sacrifices to get ahead in this business. Most of her neighbors and friends come to buy the different dishes that she offers. She will use the loan to buy rice, oil, drinks, and vegetables. In the future she wants to finish building her house and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: Vidal, de 42 años es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Bertha de 34 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejora calidad de vida. La Gran persistencia en su trabajo, le ha ayudado mucho a Vidal para llevar dinero a su casa, esta característica ha sido su principal fortaleza, ya que él trabaja cortando madera y vendiéndola como leña. Esta actividad le ha dado el dinero suficiente para ayudar en los gastos del hogar y para poder pagar la educación de sus hijos.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es plantar árboles, ya que cada vez que corta uno tiene que plantar otro, de esa manera mantiene su materia prima. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cortar los árboles, ya que siempre corre el peligro de que el árbol caiga sobre alguien, por lo cual es muy cuidadoso al hacerlo. En un futuro cercano, espera comprarse un pedazo de bosque, de donde pueda sacar madera sin tener que comprarla antes. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy querido. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevos árboles para obtener leña, de esa manera podrá cumplir con los pedidos pendiente que tiene.
texts.en:
Vidal, age 42, is a very unassuming and hard-working man. He lives in his own home with his wife Bertha, age 34, and their 4 beloved children, to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. His great persistence in his work has been a great help in bringing money into his home. This characteristic has been his main strength, since he works cutting lumber and selling it as firewood. This activity has given him sufficient funds to help with the household costs and to be able to pay for his children's education. His favourite part of his job is planting trees, since every time he cuts one he has to plant another. This way, he maintains his base of material. He has been doing this work for 2 years and finds his greatest difficulty to be having to cut down the trees, because he always runs the danger that the tree will fall on someone; so he is always very careful doing it. In the near future, he hopes to buy himself a piece of forest, from which he could take material without having to buy it first. This is his second loan with MFP. He is very happy to have obtained it and is prepared to repay all of his quotas punctually. He is very well-liked in his community bank. With the 500 soles that he is requesting, he will purchase new trees to obtain firewood. This way, he will be able to fill the pending orders that he has.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase trees.

loans.name: Sonia Magaly

texts.es:
Sonia de 30 años,  es vendedora de productos Yambal (empresa de cosméticos que vende productos a un bajo costo para mujeres emprendedoras),vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral.

Ella es madre soltera y para poder mantener a su hijo tubo que buscar un medio de dinero así que una de sus amigas la inscribió como vendedora Yambal a domicilio por catalogo. Poco a poco a tenido ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hijo. Vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar perfumes, cremas y otra parte dirigida a un nuevo negocio la venta de camarones. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa ya que ahora es una parte de caña.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 30, sells Yambal (a cosmetic company that sells products at a low cost to entrepreneurial women) products. She lives in a periurban area called Perimetral. She is a single mother, and in order to support her child she had to look for a way to earn money. One of her friends signed her up as a salesperson for Yambal. She sells at home through catalogs. Little by little she got income to cover her child’s expenses. She sells perfumes, creams, and deodorants, etc. In order to continue in her business she wants to buy perfumes and creams. The other part of the loan will be for a new business selling shrimp. In the future she wants to improve the construction of her house because part of it is made of cane.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes and creams

loans.name: El Jardin Group

texts.es:
el grupo el Jardin esta ubicado en Agua Fria Valle, esta integrado por tres mujeres, mantienen buenas relaciones y se caracterizan por ser mujeres muy unidas y solidarias, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
 
doña Nelsis M. tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos, la hija mayor le ayuda a cuidar a sus hermanos pequeños mientras Nelsis se dedica a preparar las golosinas que vende en la glorieta 
del colegio.
sus ventas son con los alumnos del colegio por la mañana y en las tardes vende refrescos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar refrescos y carnes para preparar las golosinas.

doña Maria Josefina A. tiene 49 años de edad,  tiene cuatro hijos, Maria se dedica al comercio de pan, venta de ropa usada, tamales y tortillas.
Maria es una mujer que quiere salir adelante, se esfuerza mucho para lograrlo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa usada.

la sra. Ada Nohemy C. M. tiene 24 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Su marido le ayuda economicamente todos los meses con los gastos del hogar y de los niños.
Ada se dedica a la comercializacion de perfumes, cremas, talcos, shampoos de la linea de productos avon.
Ada es maestra de educacion primaria, pero como no a encontrado trabajo durante los ultimos cinco años se a dedicado al comercio tambien prepara golosinas, como tamales, ojuelas, charamuscas, chocobananos.  de modo de tratar de salir adelante.
El credito lo utilizara para la compra de cosmeticos.
texts.en:
The “Jardin” (Garden) group is located in Agua Fria Valle. It is comprised of three women who have a good relationship. They are characterized as being very united and supportive women. What follows are details of their different activities. Nelsis M., age 40, is a single mother with three children. Her oldest daughter helps her take care of her younger siblings while Nelsis prepares the sweets that she sells at the school square. In the mornings she sells her sweets to the students at the school, and in the afternoon she sells soft drinks. She will use the loan to buy soft drinks and meat to prepare the treats. Maria Josefina A. is 49 years old, and she has four children. Maria sells bread, used clothes, tamales, and tortillas. She is a woman who wants to get ahead, and she works very hard to do so. She will use the loan to buy used clothes. Ada Nohemy C. M. is 24 years old, and she has two children. Her husband helps her every month with the household expenses and the children’s expenses. Ada sells perfumes, creams, talcum powders, and shampoos from the Avon line of products. Ada is an elementary school teacher. As she has not been able to find work during the last five years, she has devoted herself to commerce. She also makes treats like tamales, pastries, popsicles, and chocolate covered bananas. That is the way that she tries to get ahead. She will use the loan to buy cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, meat, used clothes, wheat flour to make bread, and cosmetics

loans.name: Women Of Valour Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo en el barrio Ypati de la ciudad de Villa  Elisa  por medio de otro grupo que trabaja en la misma zona, el comité cuenta actualmente con 15 integrantes todas vecinas entre si. 
Hablaremos de Fátima C. quien es la Directora del Comité, ella  es soltera, tiene 2 hijos (dos mujeres, uno de23 años y 13 años ,respectivamente)vive en su propia casa . 
 S e dedica a la venta de helados ,   que consumen tanto adultos como niños.
Fátima además  estudió peluquería en el SNPP. Ella suele realizar trabajos de peluquería en el barrio a los vecinos , como  por ejemplo : planchitas , peinados , cortes , etc. 
Ella desea ampliar su negocio comprando más variedades de helados y desearía colocar también su peluquería para tener mas ingreso para el hogar y que nada les falte tanto a ella como a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The group was formed in the Ypati district of the city of Villa Elisa and it stemmed from another group operating in the same region. The group is made up of 15 individuals; they are all neighbors. In speaking with Fatima C. we know that she is the leader of the group, she is single, and she has 2 children (both are daughters, aged 23 and 13 years old respectively). She lives in her own house. She sells ice-cream, sought out by both adults and children. Fatima also studied hair dressing at the SNPP. She provides hair dressing services for her neighbors such as ironing treatments, up-do's, hair cuts etc. She wishes to expand her business to have a wider variety of ice-cream and she would also like to set up a beauty shop to have another source of income for their household. Her goal is to always provide for herself and for her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ice cream and to make downpayments to open a store.

loans.name: Manuel Rosendo

texts.es:
Manuel de 50 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral.

Hace 7 años atrás comenzó con su tienda de vivieres ya que por su sector había la necesidad de una tienda de víveres y también necesitaba genera ingresos para su familia, poco a poco vendiendo aceites, arroz, bebidas su pequeño local se pudo surtir con mas víveres. Ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites, azúcar. En el futuro quiere tener bien surtida su tienda y poder readecuar su casa.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 50, has a small store in the front part of his house. He lives in a periurban area called Perimetral. He started his grocery store seven years ago because his sector needed a grocery store. Also, he needed to generate income for his family. Little by little he sold oil, rice, and drinks in his little place. Then he was able to stock it with more food. He now works from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. everyday. He wants to use the loan to stock his business more. He will use the loan to buy rice, oil, and sugar. In the future he wants to have a well stocked store and to be able to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, oil, and sugar

loans.name: El Polvo Group

texts.es:
el grupo denominado El Polvo esta integrado por tres mujeres que se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo, ellas son comerciantes de leche, cuajada, abarroteria, ropa y calzado, a continuacion de detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas relizan:

la señora Maria Santos F. tiene 65 años de edas, es viuda y no tiene hijos que dependan de ella.
Maria se dedica a la cria/venta de ganado y como negocio la venta de leche, todos los dias vende mas de 90 botellas de leche a las personas que se dedican a la elaboracion de queso.
el credito lo utilizara en el cultivo de pasto para el ganado.
 
doña Martha Lidia C. tiene 61 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica al negocio de pulperia desde hace 3 años. tiene muchos clientes ya que su pulperia es la única del lugar sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, en su pulperia vende arroz, frijoles, harina de maiz, aceite, frescos, lacteos, pollo, carnes y embutidos que son consumidos por los pobladores de la region. el credito lo utilizara  para invertirlo en su negocio y asi
poder atender mejor a sus clientes y por ende obtener mejores utilidades.
 
doña Josefina M. C. tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo.
Josefina se dedica al comercio de ropa americana nueva y calzado al por mayor y al detalle.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y calzado.

el sueño de estas mujeres es salir adelante con sus familias y con sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group named "El Polvo" is made up of three women who have known one another for a long time. They are sellers of milk, curd, groceries, clothing, and shoes. The following details the different activities that each woman engages in: Ms. Maria Santos F. is 65 years old, a widow, and does not have any children that are dependent on her. Maria raises and sells cattle, and makes a business of selling milk. Every day, she sells more than 90 bottles of milk to people who make cheese. She will use this loan to grow grass for the cattle. Ms. Martha Lidia C. is 61 years old, single, and has run a pulpería [small grocery store] for 3 years. She has a lot of customers because her pulpería is the only one in the area. She makes her sales every day of the week. She sells rice, beans, corn flour, oil, soft drinks, dairy products, chicken, meat, and sausages that are eaten by the people in the region. She will use this loan to invest in her business, and therefore to be able to serve her customers better and to earn better profits. Ms. Josefina M. C. is 44 years old, married, and has a son. Josefina sells new American clothing and shoes, both wholesale and retail. She will use this loan to purchase clothing and shoes. These women share a dream of moving their families and businesses ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soap, oil, butter, margarine, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, chicken, pasta, soup, milk, grass to feed cattle, clothing, and shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta de pollos y servicio de molino. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, ella es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora. Cuando ella inicio fue desde muy joven pues busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos pues tiene que mantener a sus 3 hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de equipo para el molino y compra de pollo. Ella sueña con mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria is 45 years old and she sells chicken and provides milling services. She has had this business for the past 7 years. She has always looked for a way to improve her income. She is a fighter and a hardworking woman. When she first started out she was very young and she was looking for a way to improve her income and a way to support her 3 children. The loan that she requests will be used to purchase a new mill and to purchase chicken. She dreams of always being able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Armanda

texts.es: Armanda, de 45 años, vive con Adán, de 48 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos pero solo viven con 2 de ellos, José de 20 y Jean Carlos de 12 años, juntos habitan en su casa propia en el pueblo de Palcamayo. Posee tres terrenos que son para cultivo, es así que todos los días, Armanda, sale a sembrar arvejas y espinaca; productos que cuida, riega y fertiliza durante tres meses aproximadamente; tiempo suficiente para poder cosecharlos y venderlos en el mercado central de sus localidad. Cuenta que hay temporadas en los cuales la demanda es mayor por ello viaja a la capital para poder ofrecerlos a mayor precio. Desde niña le enseñaron trabajar la tierra y producirla, sabe cuando es temporada de cultivo, cuando venderlas y a que precio; durante todo este tiempo Armanda siempre le disgusto ver como se malograban su producción debido a la constante helada que azota el sur del país.  Ahora ella quiere seguir cosechando,  por ello comprará más terrenos para así expandir la siembra. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y agradece la ayuda que le brinda su banco comunal ya que con ello puede trabajar e invertir más.  Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas de  espinaca y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Armanda, age 45, lives with Adán, age 48. They both have 5 children, but only live with 2 of them: Jose, age 20, and Jean Carlos, age 12. They live together in their own home in the Palcamayo village. They own three plots of land for growing crops. Every day, Armanda goes to sow peas and spinach: crops which she cares for, waters and fertilizers for approximately three months. This is sufficient time to harvest them and sell them in the central market of their area. She says that there are seasons when demand is greater, so she travels to the capital to offer them at a better price. From her childhood, she was taught to work the land and make it produce. She knows when it is harvest time, and when to sell and at what price; during all this time Armanda has always been upset to see her crops fail in the constant frost that batters the south of the country. She now wants to continue harvesting, so she will buy more land in order to expand her planting. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she is grateful for the help that her community bank offers her. With this help, she can work and invest more. With the loan that she is requesting, she will purchase more spinach seeds and bags of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase spinach seeds and bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Limachi

texts.es: La Sra. Salome Vive en la ciudad  La Paz, en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí, la casa donde vive es propia, ella y su esposo se esforzaron mucho para adquirir su casita , la cliente es casada con el señor Miguel Ángel de ocupación transportista. Doña salome se dedica a la venta de flores en el cementerio, cuenta con un puesto propio, lleva con esta actividad mas de 10 años. El crédito será destinado para la compra flores por temporada además de aprovechar la oferta de uno de sus proveedores, es una persona trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Salome lives in the city of La Paz, in the Villa Nuevo Potosi district. The house where she resides is her own. She and her husband worked very hard to acquire their little house. She is married and she lives with Mr. Miguel Angel, a taxi driver. Salome sells flowers in the cemetery from a stand that is her own. She has had this business for more than 10 years. The loan will be invested in the purchase of flowers for this season and to take advantage of a special offer made by one of the growers. She is a hard working person and she is very grateful for the support she receives in the form of a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flowers for the season.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
el señor Margarito A. tiene 31 años de edad, esta casado y tiene un hijo de meses. su esposa se dedica a cuidarlo, ellos viven en la aldea el Zope a escasos 800 metros de la carretera que conduce a Coyolito.
el señor Margarito se dedica al negocio de pulperia desde hace 6 años, el comento que le va muy bien y que 
las ventas se mantienen a pesar de la crisis por que pasa el pais. En su negocio vende maiz, azucar, café, frijoles, jabon, pollo, jugos, harina de maiz, manteca y refrescos,  sus clientes son los vecinos y personas que visitan el lugar ya que se encuentra ubicado en una zona cerca de la playa, este lugar es visitado por turistas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para tener mas surtido su negocio y asi ofrecerles varios productos a sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hijo y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Margarito A. is 31 years old, he is married and he has a new born baby boy. His wife stays at home to take care of him. They live in the village of El Zope, about 800 meters from the road to Coyolito. Margarito has had a grocery store for the past 6 years and he says it has been very successful. He has managed to keep up his sales despite the country's crisis. In his business he sells corn, sugar, coffee, beans, soaps, chicken, juices, corn flour, lard, and soft drinks to his clients who are his neighbors and visitors to the village. The store is located close to a beach and it is a well visited tourist area. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to restock his business so that he may offer a variety of products to his clients. He needs this source of income to cover his son's expenses and those for the entire household.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, sugar, coffee, beans, soaps, chicken, juices, corn flour, lard, and soft drinks etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es: El Sr. Florentino es  cliente  que se dedica al servicio de transporte de larga distancia quien además casi la mayoría de la semana se dedica viajando y para no poder descuidar a la familia  el viaja con la hija y la esposa  para no romper los lazos familiares ya que para el la unión familiar es importante, es muy trabajador, y responsable como Padre y esposo ya que siempre piensa en el bienestar de su familia. El dinero que el cliente necesita es para poder  reparar su automóvil ya que  es su fuente de trabajo y el cliente ahora no esta generando ingresos debido  a esto, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Florentino is a long distance public transport driver, driving almost the entire week to be able to support his family. He travels with his daughter and his wife so that the family ties will not be broken. His family is very important. He is very hard working and he is a responsible father and husband. He always thinks of the well being of his family. The funds that he needs are to repair his bus. It is his only source of work. He is currently not generating any income because of this. He is very grateful for the support he is granted.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his bus.

loans.name: Monserrate Viviana

texts.es:
Monserrate de 39 años, , tiene una tienda en la ventana delantera de su casa, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo, caracterizada por la cantidad de habitantes comerciantes. 

Hace 5 atrás el comenzó a trabajar para tener su propio negocio. Con sus ahorros ella pudo comprar víveres para ubicar una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, poco a poco construyo mejor su casa y su tienda su hijo le ayuda en la tienda cuando regresan de la escuela, ella trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22:30pm todos los días. 

Para seguir con su negocio el quiere con el préstamo comprar perfumes, arroz, bebidas, azúcar. En el futuro quiere que su hijo tenga una mejor vida y surtir su tienda con mas productos.
texts.en:
Monserrate is 39 years old and operates a store from the front window of her home. She lives in an urban area called Guasmo, characterized by the number of merchants operating from home. Five years ago she began working towards having her own business and with her savings she was able to purchase merchandise to set up a store in the front part of her home. Little by little she has been able to make improvemetns to her home and the store. Her son helps her with the store when he is home from school. She works from 6AM until 10:30PM everyday and to continue on with the business she is asking for this loan to purchase perfumes, rice, beverages, and sugar. She wants to stock her store with more products and for her child to have a better life in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, rice and lotions.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
la señora Maria Julia R. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Zope.
durante estos años a trabajado en su negocio para poder sacar adelante su familia, el esposo se dedica a la pesca artesanal, juntos se ayudan con los gastos del hogar.
Maria actualmente se dedica a vender abarroteria, frescos, jugos, agua, pollo y pescado en su pequeña pulperia.
Maria y su esposo no tienen hijos que dependen de ellos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria ya que quiere surtir mas su pulperia y asi y obtener mejores ganancias.
su proyecto a corto plazo es la recontruccion de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Julia R. is 46 years old. She lives in the village of El Zope. For years she's worked at her business to be able to help her family get ahead. Her husband is a fisherman and together they cover the home expenses. Currently Maria sells groceries, soft drinks, juices, water, chicken, and fish in her small general store. Maria and her husband don't have children that depend on them. The loan will be used to stock her store with groceries in order to increase her income. Her short-term goal is to remodel her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soap, butter, oil, margarine, rice, sugar, coffee, beans, bread, cookies, soup, soft drinks, juice, cereal, oatmeal, candles, matches, and batteries

loans.name: Manko Kapac Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Manco Kapac” ha terminado de cancelar el pago número seis y esta organizándose para iniciar el ciclo número siete.   
El grupo está compuesto por siete mujeres y un varón. 

La señora Paula, que ya cuenta con tres ciclos en la asociación, es la presidenta de la asociación.  Actualmente su negocio es la venta de comida y venta en una tienda, desde hace tres años, no tuvo un mentor que la guiara, desarrollo por si sola su negocio.
Su primer crédito fue de  $us100.- y fue utilizado en la compra de mercadería para su tienda.  Para este ciclo su solicitud fue de $us400.- y será destinado a la compra de productos para su tienda.

Las compras son realizadas por mayor de proveedores mayoristas que se encuentran en la Ceja de El Alto y las ventas se realizan en su domicilio.  Recibe la colaboración de sus hijos.
A la pregunta de qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, la señora Paula responde la capacitación y salud.

En esta asociación encontramos que diversidad de negocios, como por ejemplo: venta de comida, venta de jugos, venta de ropas de niños, venta de artículos por épocas, Snack, tienda y mecánica
texts.en:
The communal association “Manco Kapac” has finished its sixth payment and is organizing to begin its seventh loan. The group is composed of seven women and one man. Paula, who has already received three loans with the association, is the president. Currently her business is the sale of food from a shop. For three years she had no mentor to guide her and she developed the business by herself. Her first loan was for $100 and she used it to buy merchandise for her shop. For this loan she's requesting $400, which will be used to buy products for her shop. She buys her merchandise from wholesalers in la Ceja de El Alto and sells it from her home. Her children help her with the business. Paula says that what she likes most about Pro Mujer is the training and health. In this group there are diverse businesses, such as food and juice sales, clothing sales, seasonal clothing sales, snack food, and auto repair.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Santa Teresa Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo en el barrio Villa Bonita de la ciudad de Villa  Elisa , el comité cuenta actualmente con 15 integrantes todas vecinas del barrio.
