Embroidery is a popular job among ladies of Vehari, and Mukhtaran also adopted this work to financially support her family. She enjoys doing it. She crafts beautiful designs on clothes and attracts more customers.  

Her husband's name is F. M. and he is a rickshaw driver. His rickshaw has become old and needs repairing. Due to its rough condition, he can’t use it for long hours and can’t seat passengers in it. 

Mukhtaran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband. With the loan amount he will repair his rickshaw. She is hopeful that with the fully repaired rickshaw her husband will be able to work for extended hours with more efficiency.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Maria Izilda

texts.pt:
Maria izilda José M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique solteira e mãe de 1 filho que freqüenta a Escola. Fez 7ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta sua mãe e irmã que vivem com ela. 

Nunca saiu de Maputo, é comerciante ha mais de 4 anos cria frangos de abate para vender. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 25.000.00 a 30.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Já teve empréstimo na PROCREDIT e pagou sem problemas. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhas e colegas de mesma actividade, este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 30.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos e ração para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock..

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para terminar a sua casa que se encontra em construção.
texts.en:
Maria Izilda José M. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is unmarried and has one child who is in school. Maria only studied through 7th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. She lives with her family in their own house and supports her mother and sister who live with her.

Maria still lives in Maputo, where she has worked raising chickens to sell for food for more than 4 years. She has no employees and makes a profit of around 25,000 to 30,000 Meticais per month, which she uses to cover household expenses. She also saves some in her bank account.

Maria has taken out loans in the past with PROCREDIT and repaid them as promised. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through neighbors and colleagues who also work raising chickens. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 30,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy baby chicks and feed in order to increase her stock of animals. 

She is confident that she will repay the loan as indicated. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to finish work on her house.

loans.use: Purchase of baby chicks and feed

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en:
Chheang S., 32, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells groceries, earning an income of USD 12 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more construction implements to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. appears in the photograph with her husband at the CREDIT office.

loans.use: buy construction implements

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie D. S. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 49 years old. Virgie is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Virgie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing 'motorela' or 'habal-habal' (motorcycle transport) services to local community members with her husband as the driver. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virgie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Virgie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena P. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 39 years old. Elena is married. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. Elena is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim E., 56, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells fish porridge, earning an income of 11 USD per day. One of her children provides make-up services for wedding parties, earning an income of USD 10 per day.

Kim is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda A. is 44 years old, married and has one school-aged child. She is from the village of Eastern Wao Poblacion, Wao municipality in the province of Lanao del Sur on the Mindanao islands. Merlinda provides hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. She has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Merlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase beauty supplies. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her beauty business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her beauty business

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.pt:
Jorge Alberto T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de 5 filhos de 7 a 27 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Fez 12ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta seus pais enviando algum rancho alimentar. 

Nunca saiu da capital, trabalha como docente numa escola primária ha mais de 27 anos e não possui nenhum empregado. Tem um salario de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum valor na sua conta bancaria, uma vez que sua esposa também faz um negocio para ajudar nas despesas de casa.

Já teve empréstimo no Milenium BIM e pagou com muito sucesso. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas, este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto T. was born in the city of Maputo, in the Province of the same name, in southern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of 5 children ages 7 to 27.  All attend school.  He completed school through the 12th grade but did not continue due to a lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home wit his family and also supports his parents by sending them food assistance.

He still lives in the capital, and has worked as a teacher in an elementary school for more than 27 years.  He does not have any employees.  He earns a salary of 5.000.00 per month which he uses for household expenses, and he is able to save some in his bank account when his wife also works to help with household expenses. 

He already had a loan with Milenium BIM and paid it with great success.  He learned about Hluvuku through colleagues.  This is his first loan, in the amount of 20.000.00, which he will use to purchase construction materials (iron bars, cement, sand, stones, etc.) to continue building his house.  

He is confident that he will pay off the loan without any problems and request a new loan to begin his own business.

loans.use: purchase construction material (iron bars, cement, sand, stones, etc.)

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Ke N., 47, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She and her husband are police officers, earning an income of 5 USD each per day.

Ke is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to repair her house. In the future, she would like to send her children to good schools.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie D., from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur, is 50 years old., married, and has five grown children. To make a living, Lanie owns and operates a mini-restaurant serving a variety of meals to customers in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant, she is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be Lanie's second loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret B. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 7 children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her brother’s children).  

Margaret has a retail shop business.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.   Margaret sells her products in her shop, retail.     Margaret  has requested a loan of 800,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, crates of soda  and boxes of mineral water.     

The main business challenge for Margaret includes transportation of her merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala to her shop.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are owning a wholesale shop. Margaret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons  of salt,  boxes of soap and boxes of mineral water

loans.name: Enonita

texts.en:
It was six years ago when Enonita S. ventured in the buying and selling of fish. The idea of having this kind of business crossed her mind when her husband Herminio who is a fisherman caught more fish than their family could consume. Enonita sold those in their neighborhood and she realized that selling fish brings in profits bigger and faster than any other kind of business she had had in the past years of her life. Selling fish could be on a daily basis if she could buy fish from other fishermen in their village at times when her husband has a small catch. 

Unlike other products sold, fish is salable because it is one of the most basic needs of Filipinos, especially for people who live in very remote areas of the province. They are far from the municipal market thus, the possibility of buying from vendors who come to their community is very high. Also, most people choose to buy fish rather than any other meat because it is cheaper and healthier.

From then on, Enonita used her loan from ASHI in her buying and selling fish business. Out of the profit she had, she was able to invest in her home and support her family financially. 

She kept on borrowing from ASHI to keep her business growing. Now, she plans to use her newly received loan in increasing the volume of fish she buys and sells so that someday, out of her business profit, she will be able to invest more in her home. Being a 64-year-old woman, Enonita wants her son to have his own livelihood. She believes that her business is the only inheritance she can turn over to him.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
José F. conseguiu comprar todos materiais acordados e foi para o proposito que se havia planificado.

Foi possível pagar de acordo o calendário estabelecido e não teve nenhum problema, a sua obra esta decorrendo normalmente.

Houve mudanças na sua vida porque melhorou uma parte da sua residência e com o novo empréstimo no valor de 19.700.00mt pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência.

Sente se feliz com o empréstimo porque esta conseguindo dar melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimo para continuar com ampliação da sua casa.
texts.en:
José F. was able to purchase all of the agreed upon materials and they were used for the purpose that had been planned.  

He was able to pay in accordance with the established schedule and he did not have any problems.  His project is proceeding normally.  

There have been changes in his life because he improved part of his home, and with a new loan for 19.700.00mt he plans to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stones, etc.) to continue building his house. 

He is happy with the loan because he is able to provide better living conditions to his family.  In the future he plans to request more loans to continue enlarging his house.

loans.use: purchase construction material (cement, sand, stones, etc.)

loans.name: Tham

texts.en: H. Tham L. is a 36-year-old farmer who has two children in secondary school. Her main activity is growing rice in a 2,500-square-meter paddy. She also raises pigs and has 4 sows which produce piglets for her to sell. Every two months, she is abL. to sell piglets to earn money to support her family. She has been successfully repaying credit loans from our program since 2004. She is requesting a loan of 7,194,000 VND to improve her pigsties.

loans.use: To improve pigsties

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita C. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 43 years old. Nenita is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man and father of 3 school-aged children. He lives in Lebanon. He has been running a successful car painting shop for the past 35 years.  He is the main provider for his family. 

 Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to satisfy his family's needs and to pay for his children's schooling. His shop is well known by his customers due to the good reputation he has been able to build up. He has taken advantage of a first loan and he is thankful for the results. And today, he is asking for a new loan of US$ 1200 to buy additional tools for his business.  He hopes that his business will continue to grow and make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy additional tools for his business

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en: Thuong T. L. is 37 years old and has 2 children. She lives with her family in Xuan Non Commune. She has been running a delivery service by mini truck for 5 years. She has been very successful in this kind of business. Having been a client of the SEDA credit program since 2004, she has used loans very effectively to invest in her business. Now she wants to have a loan of 9,374,000 VND to buy one more truck to meet increasing demand.

loans.use: To buy a truck

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en:
Densmaa T. is a 50-year-old married woman who  lives with her husband and three children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband works as a veterinarian in the province while her son is a monk who studies and lives in a monastery. Her family's standard of living was very poor so she used to sell meals standing near a gas station. 

She started her clothes sales business in a rented stall at the local market by selling children's clothes which is not profitable. Therefore, she began to sell a variety of pants and trousers in a rented stall in the local market and has built a successful operation. Over the years, she has gained much experience in her trade. 

Densmaa is a very hardworking woman and is requesting a  1,700,000 MNT loan to purchase products and supplies for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Artur Daniel

texts.pt:
Artur Daniel Z. nasceu na Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique é casado pai de 3 filhos de 3, 14 e 19anos todos vão a Escola. Fez a 10ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras, vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta 2 irmãos que vão a escola ajudando em material didático.

Saiu de Inhambane para o Distrito de Namaacha a procura de melhores condições de vida. Trabalha como assistente Administrativo dos registo civil e notariado, onde aufere um valor mensal de 2.600.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda da esposa que faz refeições no Mercado Informal consegue poupar algum valor e já iniciou a construção de uma residência mais condigna para a sua família.

Já teve empréstimo no Milenium BIM e pagou com muito sucesso. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas, este é o seu quarto empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. Os anteriores empréstimos foram de 7.500.00, 8.500.00 e 10.000.00mt foram usados para a mesma finalidade.

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para ajudar a sua mulher a melhorar os seus negócios.
texts.en:
Artur Daniel Z. was born in the Province of Inhambane, in southern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of 3 children, ages 3, 14, and 19.  All attend school.  He attended school until the 10th grade but did not continue due to a lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family, and he also supports two brothers who attend school, helping out with school supplies.

He left Inhambane for the District of Namaacha in search of a better life.  He works as an administrative assistant in the civil registry and he is a notary.  He earns 2.600.00mt monthly, which he uses for household expenses.  With the help of his wife, who prepares meals in the informal market, he is able to save a bit, and he has begun construction on a better home for his family.  

He previously had a loan with Milenium BIM and paid it off with great success.  He learned about Hluvuku through colleagues.  This is his fourth loan, in the amount of 12.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stones, etc.) to continue building his home.  The prior loans were for 7.500.00, 8.500.00 and 10.000.00mt, and were used for the same purpose. 

He is confident that he will pay off his loan without any problems and request a new loan to help his wife improve her businesses.

loans.use: purchase construction material (cement, sand, stones, etc.)

loans.name: Arshaan's Group

texts.en:
Arshaan lives with her family in Vehari, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan. She is a housewife and stays at home. She is a very cooperative wife and a great mother who does both her responsibilities well. 

Her husband's name is M. I. and he is involved in a vegetable-selling business. He operates a small shop in the nearby market where he offers fresh vegetables to his customers. He gets up early in the morning to visit the vegetable wholesale market and buys vegetables to sell in his shop. 

Arshaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to help her husband in his business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy fresh vegetables in bulk which will cut his costs as a result of bulk purchasing and also allow him to offer different kinds of vegetables to his customer and increase his sales and income. 

Arshaan is very hopeful about her family’s bright future. She is sure that her husband’s business will improve and her family’s living standard will become better in the near future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Tan T. N. is 46 years old with two children who are in college. She has a shop that sells the fresh meat of pigs. Her shop has been open in the local market since 2005 – one year after she received a loan from SEDA.

She used her previous loan of 5,450,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) very successfully for running the shop. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy pigs as fresh products for her shop.

loans.use: To buy pigs as fresh products for her shop

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva N. is a widow  who lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Cabacungan, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   Dressmaking / Sewing , Ready-to-Wear (RTW) Sales and Food Vending businesses. Eva joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eva has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4700,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000, which she intends to use to pay for more RTW inventory and materials for her dressmaking businesses so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children.  

Eva N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and sewing materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old married man and father of two young children. He lives in Lebanon. He has over ten years of experience working with car spare parts. He has owned his own business since 2003. With his requested loan  of US$ 1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will invest in increasing his inventory and therefore increase his sales. 

In the future, he is planning to open a bigger store to trade and sell spare parts and deliver his business to other areas. He told us that he would like to one day open a commercial center.

loans.use: increasing his inventory

loans.name: Norovsuren

texts.en:
Norovsuren T. lives with her teenage daughter in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter attends a local high school. Her husband passed away so she is a widow. 

Norovsuren operates a business selling veterinary medicines and eye-glasses in her town. She started her business in 1995 by selling a variety of veterinary medicines and men's & women's clothes in a rented stall at her local market. Since then, she keeps running her pharmacy for livestock with a stable operation. 

Norovsuren also sells eye-glasses in addition to her business. She purchases her inventory for both businesses 1-2 times a month, depending on her inventory or sales. Over the years, she has gained much experience and built a positive reputation for her business in the community. She says, "In the future, I want to expand my business and also to provide for my daughter's education".  She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more veterinary medicines and eye-glasses at wholesale prices from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase more veterinary medicines and eye-glasses

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana D. is from the village of Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Juana is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Juana owns & operates a business venture in the food sector  selling dried fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish in the local community. Juana is just starting this business.

In 2006, Juana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juana is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Juana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Eastern Wao Poblacion, Wao municipality in the province of Lanao del Sur on the Mindanao islands. Mary provides multi-purpose cab services to local community members; her husband is the driver. Mary has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Mary joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to buy materials needed to provide service. Mary is requesting a new loan, her second from HSPFI, of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda M. is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing business. She lives in Prk. Ipil-ipil, Brgy Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1995 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Leonarda is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can repair and maintain her fishing boat and purchase more fishing gear and materials. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Leonarda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Repairs and maintenance of her fishing boat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Helena Da Conceicao

texts.pt:
Helena Da Conceição S. nasceu na Província de Manica, Centro de Moçambique, mãe de 6 filhos de 9 aos 29 anos de idade, os 4 mais novos é que se encontram a estudar. Fez somente 6ª classe não continuou devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com sua família e responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive com ela em sua casa.

Após o casamento Helena muda se com seu marido para o Distrito de Namaacha, onde fixa sua casa e inicia seu próprio negócio de pasteleira com ajuda do seu marido. Hoje é proprietária de uma lanchonete sita na Escola Secundária da Namaacha, conta com dois empregados que auferem 1.500.00mt cada. Tem como melhor produto de venda pastéis, chamuças, bolos e outros que tem feito por encomendas para baptismos, casamentos e aniversários. Consegue obter de lucro 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria com ajuda do marido.    

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é quarto empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar produtos (farinha de trigo, óleo alimentar e outros) para o fabrico de bolos, pasteis e chamuças. Os anteriores empréstimos foram de 18.000.00, 30.000.00 e 15.000.00mt foram usados para a mesma finalidade. 

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a obra do seu armazém no mercado informal shoprite e meter mercadoria pois ela pretende vender a grosso.
texts.en:
Helena Da Conceição S. was born in the Province of Manica, in central Mozambique.  She is mother of 6 children, ages 9 to 29.  The four youngest attend school.  Helena only completed school through the 6th grade due to an early pregnancy.  She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports her mother who lives with her.  

After marrying, Helena moved with her husband to the District of Namaacha, where she set up her home and started her own bakery business with the help of her husband.  Today she is the owner of a luncheonette located in the Namaacha high school.  She has two employees who earn 1.500.00mt each.  Her best selling items are pastries, samosas, sweet rolls, and other items that she makes on special order for baptisms, weddings, and birthdays.  She earns 10.000.00mt monthly, which she uses for household expenses and she also saves money in her bank account with her husband's help.  

She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are clients of this organization.  This is her fourth loan, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase products (wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.) to make sweet rolls, pastries and samosas.  Her prior loans were for 18.000.00, 30.000.00, and 15.000.00mt, which were used for the same purpose.  

She is confident that she will repay the loan before it is due and request a new loan to finish construction a storage unit in the shoprite informal market and stock it because she plans to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: purchase products (wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.)

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem N., 54, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. N. is a housewife. Her two children are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of USD 4 each per day to help cover the family expenses.  N. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase groceries to resell and to start a business at home. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. N.'s daughter, who work at the factory, appears in the photograph because N. was not available.

loans.use: To buy groceries to start a new business.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien T. N. is 42 years old. She is living with her family in Duong Yen village. She has two children who are going to graduate from vocational schools. She wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy a motorbike for them to go to work. 

Participating in SEDA’s credit program since 2004, she has used loans effectively in providing good educational conditions for her children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike as a means to go to work

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel R. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Maricel is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Maricel owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maricel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie E. is a married woman who lives in Purok 1, Barangay Cabacungan, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: rice farming and a livestock business. Her husband Romeo, who is 60 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 6 children who are 26 to 38 years old. 

Charlie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Charlie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13500, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29500, which she intends to use to maintain her rice field so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of the business. Charlie E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund farming operations.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret W. is forty two years old, single, and does not have any children yet. Her business is located at Juja, a busy market in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. She has been selling vegetables such as kales, potatoes, tomatoes, spinach, onions and cabbages for the last ten years to the local people, including shop owners, passers-by and students. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that there are so many other people in the area doing the same business as hers. Customers are not loyal, as they are spoiled for choice. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more vegetables to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. She also hopes to purchase a plot and build a residential house. She describes herself as God-fearing and honest.

loans.use: Vegetables.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona A. lives in the Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (relatives). Phiona has a business selling secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for many years, and she works seven days out of every week. Phiona sells her products at the market by means of retail.

Phiona has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. She also generates additional income through owning a small retail shop at which she works in the evenings. The main business challenges for Phiona include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own permanent business premises and also to start importing secondhand clothes.

Phiona lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: 060303-Quang Trung-Hoang Chau Group

texts.en:
Danh  L. T. (14) is a 57 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa. Danh  is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 060303-Quang Trung-Hoang Chau (060303-Quang Trung-Hoang Chau).

Danh  is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Danh operates a family member's agriculture business, raising livestock, primarily pigs, for saL.. Danh has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Danh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Danh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. She is now requesting a new loan of 5000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Danh from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Danh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Toi N. T. (29) is a 49 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.

2.  Danh L. T. (22) is a 53 year-old femaL., requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

3.  Luan L. T. (6) is a 53 year-old femaL.,s requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

4.  Minh C. T. (17) is a 63 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

5.  Chat L. T. (18) is a 44 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

6.  Nien N. T. (35) is a 37 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

7.  Danh L. T. (19) is a 48 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

8.  Cam L. T. (24) is a 50 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Danh  L. T. (14) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Danh  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 060303-Quang Trung-Hoang Chau (060303-Quang Trung-Hoang Chau).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Danh  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Danh  kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2005, Danh  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Danh  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua con giống.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:
1.  Toi N. T. (29) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.
2.  Danh L. T. (22) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
3.  Luan L. T. (6) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
4.  Minh C. T. (17) là 63 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
5.  Chat L. T. (18) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
6.  Nien N. T. (35) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
7.  Danh L. T. (19) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
8.  Cam L. T. (24) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Normie

texts.en:
Normie B. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Normie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Normie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling vegetables in the local community. Normie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Normie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Normie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Normie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Normie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Joao Andre

texts.pt:
João André N. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo sul de Moçambique é pai de 4 filhos. Fez o ensino médio não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria e para além da sua família responsabiliza-se pelos seus pais que vivem em Inhambane mandando lhes 500.00 mt no fim de cada mês.
Sai da casa dos pais quando começou a trabalhar como Segurança na Empresa de Telecomunicações de Moçambique (TDM), como contratado. De seguida faz um curso de professorado que durou 1 ano e é afeto para trabalhar em Impaputo uma Localidade do Distrito de Namaacha que dista 35km da Vila Municipal. E funcionário permanente ha mais de 2 anos e proprietário de um estaleiro de fabrico de blocos onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt e 4.045.00mt de seu salario por mês. Estes valores aplicam nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.
Este é o terceiro empréstimo de João na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 20.000.00 mt com o qual pretende comprar material (cimento, areia) para aumentar o stock de blocos no seu estaleiro. Os anteriores empréstimos foram de 10.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt foram aplicados na compra de material e alguns acessórios que tinham em falta no estaleiro.
Está confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros empréstimos. O seu grande sonho e terminar a obra de construção da sua residência.
texts.en:
João André N. was born in the District of Namaacha, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique.  He has 4 children.  He completed secondary school but did not continue due to financial circumstances.  He lives in his own home, and in addition to his family he supports his parents who live in Inhambane by sending them 500.00mt at the end of each month. 

He moved out of his parents' home when he began working as a security guard in the Mozambique Telecommunications Company (TDM) on contract.  He then completed a one year teaching course and was hired to work in Impaputo, a community in the District of Namaacha that is 35km from the city center. He has been a civil servant for more than 2 years.  He owns a brickyard when he earns around 8.000.00mt and he makes 4.045.00mt in salary each month.  He uses these amounts for household expenses and is able to save some in this bank account. 

This is João's third loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva, in the amount of 20.000.00 which he plans to use to purchase material (cement, sand) to increase his stock of cement blocks in his brickyard. The prior loans were for 10.000.00mt and 15.000.00mt and were used for the purchase of materials and for some items that he needed for his business.

He is confident that he will pay off the loan early in order to have access to further loans.  He dream is to complete construction on his home.

loans.use: Purchase of materials (cement, sand)

loans.name: Natig

texts.ru:
Natig K. 23 qoda. On ne jenat. Natig yavlyayetsya IDP personom on preselenec iz Fuzuli, Seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste s semyoy.

Natig uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznesom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo druqa kotoriy pomoq yemu otkrit etot magazin. Seychas Natig nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit tovari na zimniy sezon dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Natig K. is 23 years old. He is not married. Natig is an IDP (internally displaced person). He is a refugee from Fuzuli and now lives in the Absheron region together with his family. Natig has been involved in this business for 4 years. He learned this business from his friend, who helped him open this store. Now Natig needs 2000 AZN to buy merchandise for the winter season for resale and develop his own business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for resale

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en: Ngoun S., 43, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. buys rice to resell, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband sells palm juice, earning an income of USD 2 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 350 to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam B., 46, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. B. sells groceries, earning a gross income of USD 27 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 6 per day.  

B. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn T. is from the village of Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Lalyn is married and has two children. To make a living, Lalyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting, buying and selling rice. Lalyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Lalyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida belongs to a small city of Pakistan called Vehari.  Vehari is a mid-sized city and known for its agriculture industry.  She owns a small house of two rooms in a small village named 57 E/B located in Vehari.  

Rashida is a very talented and caring lady. After she finishes the household chores, she starts sewing clothes for her customers. She charges between 100-150 PKRs from her customers which they can easily pay her. She loves doing this work because she has interest in it. She sews with perfect measurement. In the working experience, she never receives any complaint from her customers. She mainly takes orders from her nearby areas and completes the orders on time to earn profit.  

Her husband's name is F. M. and he has a business selling rice. He buys rice from the wholesale market and sells in his shop to the customers. He has been in this business for the past seven years.  

Rashida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy rice in bulk quantity. She is hopeful that her husband will increase his income by selling more rice to his customers.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk quantity for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man and father of two young children. He lives in Lebanon. For the past ten years, he has made his living as a professional driver. He operates a van service for customers in his village as well as neighboring towns. Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1200 to perform much needed maintenance on his van, including changing the tires and repairing the engine. He needs to do the needed maintenance before the university period because he transports students to their universities. 

He is hoping to purchase a new car so that he can continue to expand his business. He feels positive about his business growth for the coming year.

loans.use: to perform much needed maintenance on his van

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine T. is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  Fish Vending and Vegetable vending businesses. She lives in Prk. Maitom, Brgy. Bonawon, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since October 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her fish vending and vegetable vending businesses,  she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of 8000 PHP. Josephine is now borrowing  17,000 PHP so that she  can  purchase fishing gear and equipment.   This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.

 Josephine aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Everly

texts.en:
Everly L. is from the village of Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 24 years old. Everly is married and has one infant. To make a living, Everly owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling rice in the local community. Everly has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Everly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Everly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional rice to sell. Everly is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Everly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
